deck_excerpt: Blue-eyes and Legacy of the Dragon Lords meets a anime fan trying to hearn a living out of this crazy deck that uses galaxy-eyes, stardust, red-eyes,
deck_description: Enjoy this mixed up deck that uses many iconic dragons from the show and game!! The strategy involves discarding (with "trade-in", "twin twisters" or "dragon knight of creation" effects) or sending to the graveyard (with "dragon shrine") level 7 or 8 dragon monsters and reviving then using spell cards (sucha as "return of the dragon lords") or monster effects (such as "arkbrave dragon or white stone of ancients"); You can also use nebula dragon to summon two level 8 dragon monsters to  XYZ summon powerfull allies. You can also use the tuner monsters eventually to syncro summon, but you will be better of using them as hand traps or special summoning effects. I also put two "W.D.R. Sphere mode" just in case...  Not a Meta Deck, but i won a fair amount of duels using this deck on Master Duel. If you have any suggestions, please leave a comment (I could really use some tips, because I really would like to use more of those synchro monsters). Have fun with this nostalgic, yet adapted, deck, and behold the beautiful dance of the dragons!!!

deck_excerpt: This is a Zombie World Control deck using Eldlich as an engine. I've updated it after testing it out a few times.
deck_description: Control the field by having Eldlich and Doomking Balerdroch join forces. You can also take control of the opponents monsters and expand your zombie army.  Some neat techs:  Use Lava Golem to get rid of problem monsters, even if Zombie World up, this doesn't count as a Tribute Summon, you can use this as a back up plan if Rivalry of the Warlords isn't up. Eldlich's 2nd effect will allow you to easily beat over it, with either itself or Balerdroch. Also if you have Zombie Necronize in hand, take control of Lava Golem, get your opponent to 1000 or less life points & let the burn damage finish them off next turn.  Use Vampire Sucker to get extra draws, either summon a non link monster from your opponent's graveyard, or summon a monster from your graveyard. You can also get free draws everytime Balerdroch revives itself which will also allow you to activate it's effect and banish one of your opponent's monsters.  If you manage to send a strong monster to your opponent's grave, use Red-eyes Zombie Necro Dragon's effect or Vampire Fraulein to steal them. If you manage to summon Shark Fortress, and you have the lifepoints to spare, used it's effect on Fraulein to let it attack twice and steal 2 monsters.  As long as you're not interrupted, Yuki-Onna the Absolute Zero Mayakashi can be easily summoned by using Uni-Zombie or Ash Blossom & another monster to summon Crystron Halqifibrax, use it's effect to summon Glow-up Bloom, then use both to summon Shiranui Skillsaga Supremecy. Afterwords use Glow-up Bloom's effect to summon a high leveled Zombie with Zombie World on the field. Then use both to summon Yuki-Onna. Don't attempt to do this on turn 1 just to be safe, a single Ash will ruin the combo.  Use Psy-framelord Omega to recycle banished cards including Mezuki, Necroworld Banshee, the Eldlixer & Golden Land S/T,  Zombie Necronize. You can also use it to recover Eldlich & Balerdroch incase your opponent banishes them.

deck_excerpt: Best Dark Magician deck I've tested so far in the current meta. Stay tuned for updates if any. Thank you :)
deck_description: Desk is pretty simple to use.  Main objective is to get 2 monsters on the field (such as Rod and Souls) or the sky striker 1 card combo to make Predaplant Verte Anaconda then pay 2000 LP summon Dragoon, win the game. *Eagle Booster is to make them unable to negate Verte.*  The True Name is easy to use if you combo it with Circle or Servant then free Obelisk for a turn. Link him off after battle phase.  If you have Illusion of Chaos and rites in your hand then search Sauravis for a hand negate.  If all else fails just Skill Drain Torrential and recurring beat with DM. EZ.  Game 2: Side in whatever you need to to hard counter them

PLUNDER PATROL EXPLAIN   -the strategy of the deck.   The deck has to set-up a board to resist 1 turn and then try to push damage with other cards of support.   To set-up the board you need the boats that are the “boss monster” which can negate effects and if they are equipped add some follow up for turn 2.   How to push damage? If you have a shipyard it’s very easy because all monsters gain 500 for every p.p. in spell/trap zone, then with brann you can add 500 more (if you have 2 brann you add 1000). With emblem activated targeting brann (otk machine) and shipyard on the field brann take 1000 and become a 3500 untargetable.   Also the synchro can help you ,use white aura because it’s an instant raigeki.   -how to do boats.   Use the effects of p.p. foil just be careful because they are 1.p.t. then you have to conserve a lot of resources in your hand to discard the boats, remember that blackbeard can be negated by ash, so don’t use only here because he’s dangerous.   -the effects of plunder to do plus.   eff black beard (ok) into lys (ok) lys eff. discard blue and add a card (ok) blue eff. discards white goes brrrrrrrrrr
U.C.T. BEST BOOOOOOOOY

deck_excerpt: A Pure Skull Servant Deck post feb-22 banlist, not a Zombie World build.
deck_description: Good evening, and welcome to a spooky preview of how to play Skull Servants in 2022.... I've been playing Skull Servants since 2014 on and off, and started bringing it to locals over the past year, so I'm very familiar with the core engine. This deck is made to be pure Skulls, and I'm sure a variant on this deck that runs Zombie World, Balerdoch, and Necroworld Banshee is probably more consistent, this is a more off-meta version. With that being said, let's break it down the cards, and look at some combos: Skull Servant Core: 3x Wightbaking: This is the most important card in our deck, it must be at 3, and we want to be opening it in our hand at all times. Its only down-side is that the effect is once-per-turn, so we want to try and play around some negates before we commit to sending this to graveyard. Depending on our opening hand, typically we can summon Baking and link it off to send it to grave, and complete our full combo by adding Wightprince and Wightmare, then discarding Wightmare. Keep in mind that this card specifies that you add 2 cards to hand then discard 1 - you do not have to discard one of the cards added (though most time we do), we can discard any 1 from hand. We can also discard this from hand with Uni-Zombie, and if this gets negated, we'll be able to discard it on our opponents turn when he attempts to destroy Uni-Zombie. The protection effect this card also offers to all our level 3 or lower zombies is a huge bonus, as it can keep our King + Lady boards safe. In an ideal world, we can discard 1 from the deck and keep another in our hand to protect our King on board. This is the easy MVP of the deck. 2x Wightprince: The second most important card to this combo. Sending this to grave is our priority on turn 1, as it sends two Garnets from our deck and lets us special summon King. This is a good opener in hand as well: we can play the game when we open Baking, Prince, or Uni-Zombie. By opening either Prince or Baking in hand in addition to Uni-Zombie, it allows to send both, which gives us our best opening line. I run this, the vanilla Skull Servant and Lady each at 2 because they're too cloggy at 3 and sending all 3 I think is just win-more. You could put this at 3 and leave the garnets at 2 but the 3rd becomes a brick pretty quickly, so I think that's suboptimal. Wightprince's second effect is two banish itself + two skull servants to special summon King from the deck. If you've sent two princes on the same turn, I reccomend banishing two Lady in Wights for this effect, as we can special summon them with Wightprince, but we can't special summon the vanilla unfortunately. Being able to special summon the Lady's is nice for our extended combos. 3x Wightmare: The third most important card to the combo. The ability to summon a banished King or Lady is integral to our combos. The King is simply a beater without his Lady next to him, and the only way we’re putting Lady on the board face up is with Wightmare’s effect. I think this should be run at 3 because we can resolve 3 fairly easily, but because we add it to hand with baking, I can see an argument for putting it to two. 2x King of the Skull Servants: Our boss monster. We run him at 2 because we don't want to draw it, we always want to special it off of Prince's effect. We can't special summon him with Prince's effect if he is in the hand, as Prince's effect only summons from deck, so its typically not a very good draw. Getting King + Lady on the field protects him from destruction from battle, and the effects of spells and traps, so he is surprisingly difficult to out, which is the fun of playing this deck. If you full combo turn 1, King can hit 7,000 attack turn 1 pretty easily. 2x Lady in Wight is another important combo piece. Lady protects all our level 3 or lower zombies from the effects of spells and traps, and we can special summon her from the banished zone with the effect of Wightprince, making her a valuable piece to any board we set up. We don't want to draw into this though, so we keep it at 2. 2x Skull Servant: The boy himself. Absolutely never want to draw him, so we keep it at 2 to resolve Wightprince's effect twice. That's all we need him for. Other Zombie Support: 3x Jack-o-Bolan: I love this card, I've been playing around with the ratios for a while now. Opening this card with a prince or baking lets us dump them without committing our summon, and this deck really needs that: in my experience playing, getting negated after our normal summon really holds us back. His effect to special a zombie to our field on our opponents main phase is a useful way to tag into Lady when necessary if we don't have her on our end board. His 7 levels make him an option for level 10 synchros as well: I haven't added one to this build yet, but I recommend looking into what level 10 synchros you could add to this deck (I'm thinking Baronne de Fleur). Additionally, this card is also a good target for Avendread Saviour, which we'll touch on later. I think 2x is the minimum for this, 3 could be a bit bricky so you can adjust as you see fit. 3x Uni-Zombie is a must at 3 as well. It's the third card in here we're happy to open. I prefer to have baking or prince because one Veiler and our turn is over, but that is the pit-fall of this deck as a whole. Getting to send from the deck is exactly what this deck wants, and he sets it up easily, and we can full combo from there. I previously ran an additional 3 copies of Shiranui Solitaire as a way to special summon Uni-Zombie, but I don't like being left with a completely empty board when Solitaire is negated, so I cut them. As noted above, if Uni-Zombie does get negated, our turn is basically done but if we have a Baking in hand, it gives us at least something on our opponents turn. 1x Mezuki: Mezuki is a great extender - if we don't need to dump a combo piece from deck with Uni-Zombie, we can dump this instead to bring a card back for extending our combos. It's very nice to be able to dump, but we only need 1 copy in my opinion, we aren't recycling cards that often, plus Wightmare allows to do the same from the Banish pile. Extras: 1x Destrudo: Fresh off the banlist, this card is cracked, very much worth running. We can get in grave easily, and search it off Halq too. Worth trying out. 1x Pankertops: We're happy going second, and this is a nice piece going 2nd as well. Our end-board is typically just 2 monsters so there's plenty opportunity to summon this vs meta decks. Hand-Traps 3x Ash Blossom: needs no introduction, pretty much mandatory. All the ghost girls have nice utility as level 3 zombies in here as well, so its good to keep in mind. 3x Nibiru: this deck gets killed by combo players that can set up huge boards with negates and such, so I think we have to run 3 Nibiru in main to shut that down. 3x Impermanence: like Ash, needs no introduction. A nice piece of interruption, we don't want to let our opponents get set up. Like always with hand traps, it depends what you're playing into. If you'd rather run Belle, Ghost Ogre, DD Crow, Droll, Veiler, etc that's your call. I previously ran Veiler in this build as a searchable level 1 tuner with Halqifibrax with the ability to synchro with Jack-o-Bolan but it didn't come up super often. Spells and Traps 1x Foolish Burial: Best card in our deck, wish we could have more than 1. Starts our combos. 1x One for One: Another great starter piece for us, also limited to 1. Also starts our combos. 1x Monster Reborn: great extender if we send 1 Wightprince, we can reborn it and link it back to the grave and get the effect again as its not once per turn. Allows us to re-start combos with our grave if we top-deck it too. Would love more than 1 of this too. 1x Called by the Grave: Also limited to 1, great interruption, always feels like a game-winner to pull this 3x Where arf thou: Very nice extender. After sending Prince and special summoning King, we can activate this and normal summon to avoid the cost if we want. We're mostly fine with paying the cost if necessary though. Alternatively, if we can make our regular board already, use this to add Wightbaking at the end of turn to protect your King and Lady on your opponents turn – its well worth the 2000 life points. 1x Burial From a Different Dimension: We banish 3 to Special King. This returns 3 to the grave. Self explanatory I think. I've run this at 2 and 3, but its bricky at 3. You could run this at 2, but I'm happy with 1. Don’t forget to special summon Lady with Wightmare before activating this if you haven’t got her on board. Extra Deck: 1x Linkuriboh and Salamangreat Almiraj serve the same purpose as link fodder to send a baking or prince off our board to open a combo. Use Linkuriboh in your King + Lady lines for one added line of protection. Use Almiraj if you’re planning to make Accesscode so you’ll have the fire attribute for his effect and you’re not making Phoenix, as Unicorn will give you the Dark attribute already. 1x Avendread Saviour gives us another way to discard from the deck, so we can make this reasonably often. Having 3 level 7 zombies in the deck gives us a little more utility to this effect too for clearing boards. 1x Vampire Sucker: we can make this along a combo chain to draw a card as we’re summoning. The second effect of summoning from our opponents grave to their field is an underrated tool to bust up potential combos our opponents is setting up later than turn 1. 1x Knightmare Phoenix and Unicorn – need no introduction I think, they can go in any extra deck, and are basically mandatory for going into Accesscode. 1x Masquerena – Interruption for our opponents turn to go into Unicorn. 1x Halqifibrax – Great extender that we make with Uni-zombie fairly often, opens us up to Link 4s easily. 1x Apollousa, Bow of the Goddess – the best interruption we can make. Great end board card for our turn 1s, but we should look to make 4 negates where we can. How to play Skull Servants: This deck is very simple to play, we don't vary off of our main line too often. Our end board can typically be Apollusa and Omega if we want, or finish on King/Lady and other pieces. The basic line: Our basic combo is as follows: Send Wightbaking to grave (the two ways we commonly accomplish this is 1) normal Baking and Link-1, or 2) effect of Uni-Zombie, but foolish burial and one for one can get us there too). We then add Wightprince and Wightmare to hand, and discard Prince. -> Prince effect to send a skull servant and Lady in Wight -> Prince 2nd effect to Special Summon King of the Skull Servants. -> Send Wightmare from hand to Special Summon Lady in Wight. Now we have King at 2k and protected by Lady. extended line: our extended line is any line that pitches both Wightprinces. We can do this pretty easily by opening Prince or Baking in hand, and anything that lets us send it from the hand: One for One, Uni-Zombie, Jack-o-Bolan all give us this. Where Are Thou also lets us add one if we didn't open one in hand. In this line, we usually want to send Wightprince first, and Baking second to scout Ash, as we prefer Baking to resolve. We also want to send both Princes before Special Summoning King if we can. If we do so, it allows to banish both Lady's from grave and special them both if we opened with a Wightmare (in addition to adding one with Baking effect). Always keep in mind that Wightbaking is a once-per-turn effect, but Wightprince is not – if Baking is negated by Ash, we can’t send a second copy that same turn. full combo (god-hand opening): In terms of full combo, the biggest board we can finish on turn 1 is a King at 4k, an Apollusa with 4 negates and Psy Framelord Omega. A line that lets us do this requires Prince/Baking in hand with Jack-o-Bolan, Uni-Zombie as our normal summon, another way to send a prince, and Reborn or Foolish. We can make this board by pitching Baking to Special Jack-o-Bolan, complete our basic combo with Baking effect, and send our 2nd Prince. Special Lady with Wightmare, and you have a board of Jack, King, and Lady with no summon committed yet. We can normal Uni-Zombie and use effect to pitch Mezuki, Reborn Mezuki, synchro into Omega with Uni-Zombie and Mezuki. Use Mezuki to bring back a Lady and link-4 the remaining monsters to make Apollusa. Finally, you can activate your 2nd prince in grave and pitch both Ladys to finish with a King on board as well. In my experience, this is the biggest board we can make going first with the cards in this deck list. Depending on what you’re playing into, this kind of hand gives you endless options for what to do with your turn. King and Lady on board vs Extra deck monsters? One scenario you’ll face pretty often with this deck is you’ll have King + Lady on board as special summons, and likely one other piece (a linkuriboh or a Uni-Zombie that started your combo). With Uni-Zombie and Lady you’ll have the option to go into a Synchro 8 if you used both Uni effects, or link 2 into Halqifibrax and go into Apollusa from there. I’ve gone back and forth on what I think is better, but at the moment I think I prefer setting up King/ Lady and pass than making Omega or Apo with 3 negates. A big plus to finishing on King/Lady is if we can keep a Wightbaking in hand with this board – it gives full protection to an attempt to pop King or Lady from the board, and lets us resolve baking’s effect again on our opponents turn. In this scenario, they’ll have to commit further resources to removing King, and if we aren’t OTK’d, we’ll be able to make another King/Lady board on our next turn. Shorter/Alternative lines: In my opinion, these going-first boards are fine, and we're happy to make them into combo decks, but we need a good opening hand. My feeling is that we're better off going second if we're not playing into an opponent setting up negates. A lot of our lines on turn 2 lead us into making Abyss Dweller (and into Zeus from there if we want). If we’re going 2nd and we have a weak hand but we can muster 2 summons, we can make Avendread Savior and attack into our opponent to dump a prince or baking. Avendread is a good utility summon for this reason, and he’s also good because we can dump Jack-O-Bolan to decrease an opponents attack by 1400. This line doesn’t feel great but if we dump Baking from Avendread, we can set up our King + Lady in Main Phase 2 at least. With Destrudo, I haven’t gotten a physical copy to test out combos with this, but it definitely adds a lot of options to our turns. Upgrades and Changes to this deck Main Deck: Shiranui Solitaire: I previously ran this at 3. It’s 3 more chances to draw into Uni-Zombie and begin your combo, but I took it out simply because if this effect is negated after tributing itself for cost, you are left with an empty board. If you wanted to run this, I’d suggest running a heavier hand trap/trap ratio in the deck, and particularly adding Gamma and Driver into main as an option on your opponents turn to prevent an OTK. I could see this at 1 copy in the deck as a small consistency boost, but I don’t like to rely on it. Wightprincess: The one monster from the archtype we’re not running: the effect of spending our normal summon to pitch Wightprince was nice at the time it was released, but its way too slow of a card to run now, and is functionally a weaker version of Baking. Being level 3 and 1600 attack, we can’t make a link-1 with this either. You could run this at 1, as the hand-trap effect to reduce the attack of all monsters is good in niche scenarios, but I don’t think that’s enough to warrant putting it into the main. Another reason to run this is that its another “Skull Servant” name that can be searched off Baking, so you get some utility from that. I don’t see room for it, but you can give consideration to adding 1. Mathematician: This was a core card in the deck once upon a time, but we don’t run it now. You could certainly run 1 copy as a potential opener, but its completely dead to a hand trap at the cost of your normal summon, and the draw effect is unlikely to resolve too. Allure of Darkness: I just recently cut this, but you could find room for 1 or 2 copies for the draw power. My issue is that after we do our opening combo, there aren’t a lot of good DARK targets left to discard in the deck. We run 15 DARKs, but a Uni-Zombie opening combo will use up 7 of them at least, so we’ll discarding our hand pretty often. Crush Card, Deck Devastator, Eradicator Epidemic Virus: All the virus cards are live with this deck thanks to King. They’re an interesting tech option for certain matchups: the added “look at your opponents hand” is a huge plus and you can discard a lot of cards off this. However, running them in main is a crap shoot, and if you’re playing a deck that wants to be discarding cards like we do, you’re in big trouble. Extra Deck: 1x Baronne De Fleur is a very pricey card, but would undoubtedly be incredibly strong in this deck, as he is in many others. This deck would love a level 10 Synchro and Baronne is the best of the bunch. The reason we love a level 10 is because we have Jack-o-Bolan at level 7, and we have six tuners (3 Ash and 3 Uni-Zombie) that are level 3 to make Baronne easily. If you have the cash, put this in, and take Scarlight out. 1x Relinquished Anima is a good alternative at link 1, its your preference in that category. 1x Coral Dragon is a level 6 synchro I used to run in this deck, its very good, I only cut it for space. Lady in Wight + either tuner in the deck make this easily, and its ability to discard 1 is always something we like in the deck to start combos. If there’s card in this extra deck you don’t like, this is something you can sub in with ease. 1x Trishula has been cut from this deck for space too, but it’s a nice option going second. If you alter this build to be more oriented to going second, consider adding it back in. At level 9 + 3 materials required, it’s a little steep, but its easily made with Uni-Zombie (after resolving both his effects), Lady + King as materials. 1x Clear Wing Synchro Dragon is a great generic level 7 synchro, we make it easily with Uni-Zombie + Lady, and the effect is very good. When I ran it, I almost never made it though, so I cut it for that reason. Rank 1, 2, 3 & 4 XYZs: Uni-Zombie’s ability to boost its own level plus Lady’s level means the door is open to any Rank 3 or 4s: if you summon two level 1 monsters, Uni-Zombie could boost them both to level 2 for rank 2s as well, though this is a much less likely occurrence. There’s a huge selection of XYZ monsters to select from, so its worth your time having a look, particularly Rank 4s. I settled on Dweller and Nightingale as my 2 XYZs for getting to Zeus, but other XYZ monsters I’ve rotated in and out include: 1x Break Sword: A 2k beater that can pop a card from your opponents field if necessary, it’s a nice card for transitioning into Zeus with added utility from its effect. This could easily fit right in this deck. 1x Leviair the Sea Dragon: used to feature in this deck. Really good, but when I want to make an XYZ, I lean to a preference to Dweller, but Leviair is a great fit too. 1x Castel the Skyblaster: I love Castel so much, I put him back in every so often, he’s the 16th extra deck monster of this deck for me. 2k attack makes him a great Zeus buffer, and his effect to book-of-moon something so you can essentially attack for free makes him a great option. 1x Downerd Magician: No explanation needed really, one extra material for Zeus. I don’t see room for this but if you want to play more towards Zeus turbo, slide it in. 1x Sylvan Princessprite: A good option for a rank 1 – detaching a material is a good way to put 1 card in the graveyard, and the effect of excavating one benefits us a lot of the time, whether we add a spell or send a monster to the grave. I have run this, but I prefer Nightingale for making Zeus. Strengths and Weaknesses: Strength – Big Number go brrr: Even against meta decks, you’ll be surprised with how often 5,000 attack and cannot be destroyed by battle becomes a difficult obstacle, especially with Lady on the field, and a Baking in hand. Additionally, our King can push 10k off of full combo, so an OTK is in our reach as well, so we can upset meta decks if they brick an opening hand Strength – low summon count: Unless we want to make the full Apollusa combo, our standard King + Lady summon combo will cost us 4 summons, so we dodge Nibiru quite comfortably. Weakness – consistency: the Lady in Wight’s and Skull Servant’s are basically 4 garnets in this deck, and the Wightmares are only extenders, not openers, so we brick quite a lot. Running up to 15 hand traps may be a better alternative approach to this deck to help survive, because there aren’t more engine cards to include, except maybe a 3rd copy of Wightprince, which itself becomes a brick if we combo successfully. Weakness – Negates: We can’t play through negates, that’s all there is to say. If we get Ashed or Impermed or Veilered on our opening move, we’re toast pretty often. If our opponent sets up Apollusa or anything that negates effects on their turn, we’re not getting off the ground. Weakness – Negates of our own: Baronne would help with this, but we equally don’t set up enough negates of our own. I added Apollusa to help this, but it takes a big combo to make 4 negates with her. Consider adding more interruption to this deck to overcome this. Combo decks can really play through us with relative ease in my experience. Conclusion Skull Servants are a super fun deck, and I absolutely love them. They’re not tier 1 by any means, but I have fun with them at locals for the most part. I feel like a smarter player than me could find ways to make this more consistent: in particular, we’re really craving more ways to special summon or send from the deck, so our opening turn doesn’t get shut out by negates so easily. That said, if you can make a board, you’ll win plenty of games. So that’s it! If you have any thoughts or suggestions for the deck, I’d love to hear, as I’m always looking for improvements to make. For starters I’ll need to experiment with Zombie World in here, but I’d love to hear more builds for a pure Skull Servant deck. If you read this all the way to the end, thank you so much for reading!
FTK

deck_excerpt: Draw up to 3 cards from one continuous effect (even in your opponent's turn). Deck is based on: cards which greatly devastate the opponent's deck, dis
deck_description:
Draw up to 3 cards from one continuous effect (even in your opponent's turn). Deck is based on: cards which greatly devastate the opponent's deck, discard (even all cards in opponent hand) and disturbing the opponent at every turn HF ;) Mysterune archetyp IMO will quickly join to Meta decks  (combined, of course, with other archetypes). As long as he doesn't get hurt too much through the next banlists. I've already tested him well and it definitely has a lot of potential. That's why I decided to do a short Mysterune decks series. So far I have created one more foolproof Mysterune deck, which I will present on Friday, February 25. There is more negates in the next deck and more use of monsters from the Extra deck. If people like it I'll make more decks with this archetyp. I saw that initially this archetype was very popular in Edo (right after the premiere), but perhaps the unsuccessful attempts to create something unfailing discouraged people. I will be happy if I can show you new ways to make meaningful use of the Mysterune archetype.   Ok, now let's move on to the description of the deck (because not everything is as obvious as it seems).
  1. The first words on each Mysterune card  "Activate 1 of these effects; skip your next Battle Phase after this card resolves." It's obvious we won't be attacking too much in this deck ( in next we will attack more and even we will possess OTK) . Therefore, it is very important to start Battle Phase, then is considered to be skip, this is very important if we want to attack later.
  2. "Spring of the Mysterune" it is the most important card in this archetype, And I assure you that we will not run out of this card in my decks ( without Planet Pathfinder, Demise of the Land and without other unnecessary things). But that's not the most important thing here. It is most important to use this card with moderation. Not try to draw three cards over and over again, by throwing cards that will surely be useful in the next round (for example "Mysterune of the Freezing Curse"). Usually, the optimal number of cards to be draw is two. Let's not be too greedy and remember that: in the next round we will also draw cards. One more important thing here. if we have in hand "Droll & Lock Bird" we should make sure that we draws cards faster, before your opponent start adds hiss cards, so as not to be stopped by your own effect.
  3. "Nibiru, the Primal Being" this card will not be useful against some decks, but I decided to use it because the biggest threat to Mysterune are combo decks. At worst, we can use Nibiru with effect "Muninn, Wings of the Mysterune".
  4. "Droll & Lock Bird" What can I say, this card has stopped many decks and sometimes completely paralyzed the opponent.  Especially useful when  opponent starts the game.  But in this case it has a  second special meaning. Because we can use him in a combo with one or two other cards to banish all cards in opponent hand. And in most cases it means almost instant win.
  5. "Mysterune of Dispel" remember that this card can only be used immediately after "add" effect resolves.
  6. This deck will require skillful juggling of the Field cards, and sometimes also use "Mysterune of Destruction". The deck takes a bit of practice but then gives a lot.
Tips and tricks: Use "Mysterune of the Golden Droplets" in a combo with "Mysterune of Dispel" and, if possible with "Deceit of the Mysterune" (but not at any cost) to maximize damage to your opponent's deck. To draw more cards with an effect "Spring of the Mysterune" use Mysterune Quick-Play Spell, special summon "Muninn, Wings of the Mysterune" and discard 1 Mysterune Quick-Play Spell in chain link 1, chain link 2 use "Spring of the Mysterune", then you will draw one additional card (attention, use common sense - same as above in the second point). And probably the most anticipated - discard  all cards in opponent hand combo. For this we can use basically 2 cards "Droll & Lock Bird" and "Trickstar Reincarnation". With this setting, we wait for the opponent to add a card from the deck by himself  (we are waiting for the effect resolves) and then we use "Trickstar Reincarnation" in chain link 1 and "Droll & Lock Bird" in chain link 2 - that's all ;) Ok, but if  opponent will not add anything ? No problem here, we can use 3 card combo. For this we can use "Droll & Lock Bird"  and 2 copie "Trickstar Reincarnation" or "Droll & Lock Bird" and 1 "Mysterune of the Golden Droplets" and 1 "Trickstar Reincarnation".  We are using "Mysterune of the Golden Droplets" or first copie "Trickstar Reincarnation" (we are waiting for the effect resolves) and then we use "Trickstar Reincarnation" in chain link 1 and "Droll & Lock Bird" in chain link 2 - simple. deck_excerpt: Thunder King Rai-Oh finally got a consistent deck strategy.
deck_description: This deck consists on bring thunder king Rai-Oh to the field as soon as possible, while have many defensive and board breaking cards to backup this strategy.  There are 3 main basic combos:  - pa/ma and solar: normal summon pa/ma, activate its effects to normal summon solar, activate solars effects to send rai-oh to the gy, link pa/ma and solar into summoner and pass. During your opponent turn, activate summoner effect to special summon rai-oh from gy.  - pa/ma and bro: normal summon pa/ma, activate its effect to normal summon Bro, activate Bro effect to search rai-oh, link pa/ma and bro into summoner and pass. During your opponent turn, activate summoner effect by discarding rai-oh from your hand and special summon it from gy (this Works because you Will have thunder monsters previously in your gy by the time you discard rai-oh).  - Photo sanctuary and rai-oh: activate photon sanctuary to special summon 2 tokens, link the tokens into summoner, normal summon rai-oh. You Will already have rai-oh onvthe field, but If you use its Second effect, you can revive him with summoner by discard a card, during your opponent turn.     This deck is a midrange deck that can both go first and second, his going First can be strange against a deck that are ficcused on breaking boards and its going second can be akward against decks that have multiples negates like 4+ negates. Overral its a balanced deck. Also the ratio of the quantitiesbof monsters, spells and traps being like that was made on purpose, só If the opponent Lock onde type of card, ill have other 2 to Work with. And each type of card have a main function: monsters are the main engine, spells are utility (extenders, draw and recycle), and traps are defenses (going First and going second defenses). The extradeck se have summoner, super Poly targets and some toolbox options that do have any major conflict with the other cards in the deck.
Gren Maju Anti-Meta (FEB 2022)

deck_excerpt: A deck that does not necessarily have a defined footing in terms of play style (yet) but can be very versatile depending on which shell you place it t
deck_description: Hi, Grayewick the Fusionist here, back with an update with my testing to the Icejade strategy and I think I might have found the perfect shell for the deck as the center piece of the deck instead of being just a complementary engine to Invoked and a substitute budget options for Shaddolls, presenting Icejade Dogmatika. Yes, I am playing the boring ass Adventurer Token engine just because I can and it does not necessarily conflict with the deck, but hey. These slots could be for anything like hand traps or floodgates, or control tools like the Solemn traps, really. As per usual, the side will be the side deck of my preference, but it realistically could be for anything of your liking. Addressing the list: • x1 Icejade Kosmochlor - This is your boss monster of the deck. Her, alongside your Field Spell Icejade Cenote Enion Cradle and Icejade Curse effectively locks your opponent out of using monster effects on the field, essentially providing you a one-sided Skill Drain. With the help of Icejade Cradle, this three card combo setup is not really as hard as you might think to pull off. • x1 Icejade Creation Kingfisher - One of your ways to interrupt your opponent, sadly it's not a Quick Effect, but it enables Icejade Kosmochlor to attack safely in Defense Position. • x3 Foolish Burial Goods & x1 Bridge of Salvation, Metalfoes Fusion, and Rainbow Dragon, the Zenith Crystal Beast - As I have discussed in my previous Invoked Dogmatika Shaddoll Icejades list (here's the link for those that are interested: https://ygoprodeck.com/invoked-dogmatika-shaddoll-icejades/), it's a one card combo that essentially lets you search your Field Spell instead of spending Icejade Aegirine's effect to do so, with Rainbow Dragon, the Zenith Crystal Beast as a bridge and also a discard fodder for your Fateful Adventure. Metalfoes Fusion is just a free draw card off of Foolish Burial Goods. • x1 Icejade Erosion - One of your primary forms of interruption. Is searchable, which is nice. • x1 Fossil Warrior Skull Knight & Fossil Machine Skull Wagon - Targeting Monster and Spell/Trap removal, respectively. • x1 Toadally Awesome - Could be used either as just Dogmatika Maximus fodder or a way to recycle Icejade monsters from your GY to your hand. In conclusion, I think Icejades now have a game plan albeit slow and control/stun focused, although I still believe that they should receive a dedicated summoning mechanic support (hopefully through Fusion summoning, for obvious reasons) in the future, but as of now, I wouldn't say that they're in a bad place, nor are they unplayable. If I were to describe their play style, it's just not for everybody. There are some few quirks to it, but it's not flashy. They can comfortably play under floodgates like There Can Be Only One, Gozen Match, Rivalry of Warlords, and to an extent even Skill Drain. Overall, I think it's a deck that performs relative to what the pilot desires it to do, be it just as a complementary engine or as the center piece, or be it as a tool to help you Link climb due to the free bodies you can bring out to the board or to assist you in making a more control/stun focused game plan. I am excited to build this deck in real life and to see how well it fares against the other decks be it in or out of the ladder. If you have any questions or thoughts, feel free to express them down in the comments and I'll respond to them as soon as I possibly can.

deck_excerpt: King's Court Poker Knights mixed with Egyptian Gods (Default Slifer)
deck_description: My basic Royal Court/Egyptian Gods Deck. Generally focuses around getting the knights out so you can summon a god of your choice. Slifer is the most obvious choice because of Thunderspeed Summon, but Ra can also work. Obelisk is a bit tricky if you don't already have him in your hand, but Arcana Triumph Joker is a decent search of Thunderspeed as well. I also recommend running the supporting God Card spells so you can get the most out of them.  Extra Deck has the Arcana knights to go with the Poker Knights, along with the usual Knightmare link support. I decided to run Utopic Draco future here as well just because I pulled one a while back and wanted to see if I could make him work here as an alternate win option. Using tornado dragons to go into Utopic Future, then from there into Utopic Draco should be fairly easy to do with this deck. Even with negates the amount of cycling that you can do with the Poker Knights now gives them a lot of potential options.  If anyone has any suggestions on how to improve this deck feel free to comment.

deck_excerpt: Turbo out Evil★Twins Ki-sikil & Lil-la, or bring out one of Accesscode Talker, Borreload Dragon, Knightmare Gryphon, or Unchained Abomination with rel
deck_description: The goal of this deck is go turbo out Evil★Twins Ki-sikil & Lil-la. If you're able to, you usually want to go second, so you can lightning storm anything the opponent might play (assuming you draw it turn 1), and also because this deck can have a hard time dealing with turn one removal from the opponent. You will usually want to get either Live☆Twin Ki-sikil or Live☆Twin Lil-la out on the field turn one with your normal summon if you draw them or get them to your hand with Live☆Twin Sunny's Snitch, then activate their effect to special summon the other one to the field from your deck. From there, you want to get out both Evil★Twin Ki-sikil and Evil★Twin Lil-la by link summoning one, then activating the effect to bring back one link material, link summon the other one with the material you brought back and the other link monster, then use their effect to bring back the other Evil★Twin from the graveyard. Depending on what you need right then and there, you have a few options. If you have Evil★Twins Ki-sikil & Lil-la, you can special summon it there for a 4400 Atk beatstick that can cut your opponents board to size, or you can summon unchained abomination or knightmare gryphon depending on your immediate needs. If you draw foolish burial, you'll want to send Evil★Twins Ki-sikil & Lil-la to the graveyard. It was added as a way to more consistently get that card to a position it can be summoned in.

deck_excerpt: The awesome Rank 10 Trains deck that carried me to Platinum Ranking in Master Duel!
deck_description: This is the deck I piloted to reach Platinum Ranking in Master Duel. Its my beloved Rank 10 Trains! If you're going first, turbo out Number 81: Superdreadnought Rail Cannon Super Dora and use it to bunker yourself in. They key is to summon Number 81 in defense position unless you have a Spin Turn set face down. In which case you summon the big girl into atk mode.  Your win condition and big end all show stopping finisher is always going to be Superdreadnought Rail Cannon Juggernaut Liebe. That thing hits HARD! If you're going second. Be mindful of Maxx C, but go for the OTK play and summon out Superdreadnought Rail Cannon Juggernaut Liebe. Keep yourself clear of backrow. If the game is going into a grindy late game, we have 2 options. Stall and Grindy decks have absolutely no counter plays to an incoming Infinitrack Fortress Megaclops! Absolutely impossible card to deal with. Never be afraid to commit to turbo summoning out the Megaclops. It's almost impossible to survive. If you can't realistically get Megaclops out, go for plan C which is Cyber Dragon Infinity. Don't rely on Infinity or use it as your main game plan. It may seem like a perfect thing to race into in a vacuum, but this not the goal of the deck. You'll find yourself losing steam if you spam out Infinity on turn 1. Instead, keep Infinity as the ace in the hole, your last ditch effort.

deck_excerpt: Using Piri Reis Map, Royal Magical Library hits the field with more consistency. Double Summon lets you use two Royal Magical Library during this FTK
deck_description: The idea of this deck is simple. Get all Forbidden One pieces in your hand during your first turn.  Royal Magical Library is a great help in that, and this deck focuses more than most other Exodia decks on making sure we have it on the field on your first turn. Piri Reis Map does exactly that. It does get negated by Ash Blossom, but as long as the opponent doesn't have that, it's another way to get Royal Magical Library on your field as soon as possible, to help with drawing cards.  Another thing that isn't common in decks like this is the use of Double Summon. Why use one Royal Magical Library when you can use two? If you can get both out, it can bring out so much advantage. This deck can have hands you cannot play with sometimes, but if you can manage to get two Royal Magical Library on the field, it's nearly always possible to have multiple cards you can play.  Foolish Burial Goods is in the deck to send Cursed Bamboo Sword to the GY. Doing so allows you to activate Cursed Bamboo Sword's final effect, usually to add Golden Bamboo Sword to your hand. If you already have that but no Equip Spell Bamboo Sword, you could add the one copy of Broken Bamboo Sword as well.

deck_excerpt: Darklords summon and play spells/traps from the GY! Features The First Darklord and The Chaos Ruler.
deck_description: EDIT: Needs revision, I missed the vital card text on Darklord Ixchel that reads "...target 1 "Darklord" Spell/Trap in your GY..." so this will not work with any Spell/Trap. I'm disappointed, but experimenting with other cards like Spell Reproduction... I just built this deck, still playtesting. What sparked my interest in building the deck is the challenge in Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel to "Take control of X opponent monsters". I also pulled The First Darklord, so I thought it would be cool to summon him. I've experimented with Darklord Nurse Reficule deck, and wanted to build another Darklord deck, though I don't have much experience at all playing Fusion monsters. So far, I have found that Diviner of the Herald + Darklord Contact is a great starting hand. Target Darklord Ukoback with Diviner, and then Dark Contact Ukoback to get Chaos Ruler, The Chaotic Magical Dragon out fast. Darklord Ixchel and Darklord Amdusc are great for playing Spell/Trap cards from the GY, like Necro Fusion or Greater Polymerization. Sending the Spell/Trap cards you need in GY with Foolish Burial Grounds. I'm thinking that Banishment of the Darklords should usually fetch Darklord Contact, as Contact is what gets you Ixchel or Amdusc on the field to start targeting Spell/Traps in the GY. Can also send Called by the Grave or Infinite Impermanence to the GY with Foolish Burial Grounds, to prep counters to hand traps or monster effects, depending on your matchup. Don't forget to take advantage of that card draw with Darklord Ixchel! Can use the link Code monsters from the extra deck if you get bricked on your starting hand/draws. Halqifribrax --> Phonon Pulse Dragon --> Chaos Ruler, The Chaotic Magical Dragon might work, though I have not needed to go that route in playtesting just yet. Darklord Enchantment and Grinning Grave Virus are mostly for fun and can be replaced by better cards. I'm only Gold Rank in Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel, so I'm still learning! This is my first attempt at building a deck from scratch. Any help/tips, strats I have missed, or card suggestions, would be much appreciated. 🙏

deck_excerpt: Pengu frog is a board spam link/synchro centric water deck built around the genex undine, halqifibrix, frog and penguin engines. Play this deck if you
deck_description: Introduction To Pengu Frog-  Hello! My name is DapperCalf, and today Ill be explaining to you all why you should play the hottest new deck on the market: Pengu frog. Pengu frog is a board spam link/synchro centric water deck built around four seperate and powerful engines : The frog engine, the penguin engine, halqifibrax synchro summon chains, and the undine/crystron engine. Why invest your funds into pengu frog instead of playing, I dont know, a good deck? Good question! Let me answer that question with a better one; do you like toad puns? does the idea of playing a deck that contains penguin soldier excite you? Do the names TOADally awesome, roninTOADin, NOPEnguin, and MISTAR(mister and star its a whole thing idk google star boy) boy intrigue you? Is my third question the same as my first? Idk what else to put as an intro so Im just gonna go straight into the magic of explaining combos.  Genex undine opening: Summon genex undine(making sure to leave the space under your link zone open! dont make the same mistakes I do.) using his effect to send crystron rosenix to the grave, adding a genex controller to hand. banish rosenix from graveyard to create a token, use the token to make a link spider. use the link spider to special summon controller from your hand, use controller and link spider to make haliqfibrax, use haliqfibrax to special gluttonous reptolphion greethys, use greethys and undine to make penguin brave, using penguine brave to make penguin soldier. on your opponents next turn, you then have the option to use brave to flip soldier and then use haliqfibrax to make shooting star riser dragon, sending treeborn frog and using riser and soldier to make a borreload, attaching link spider for a negate. you can also just use formula syncron and brave, but then you lose a 4k~ atk beater and that makes me sad. if youve used any of the frog combos to get a frog in play, you can also opt to make trishula here(summoning treeborn frog with toadally awesome and using haliq for formula synchron and then using treeborn + brave + synchron)  Basic Frog Combo Opening: all this requires is swap frog + a water monster in your hand. discard a water monster and then send a ronin toadin from your deck to grave. then if you didnt send a frog from your graveyard, normal summon any water monster. use the water monster + swap frog to make a coral anemone. then use anemone to special summon swap frog from grave, sending another frog to use for ronintoadins effect. special ronin from grave with his effect, and make toadally awesome.  Advanced Frog Combo Opening: If you open with a ronin toadin or another frog in your hand, + a swap frog, you can do the above combo but end on mistar boy, coral anemone, AND toadally awesome. follow the above steps but when you special the swap frog from your grave, send another ronin toadin from deck to grave. then use swap frog and ronin to make a mistar boy, and then follow the rest of the steps as normal, banishing swap frog + your other frog to summon two ronins and make a toadally awesome using them.  Other cool things you can do: you can summon many water type links/appoulousa or access code hilariously easily using frogs + the genex undine combo. you can also do it withou an undine, using rosenix and swap frog as materials, linking them together for a halq, using halq to get a monster from deck, banishing swap frog to make ronin and then linking into an apo or ACT. all of that without even using your normal summon!  IMPORTANT THINGS TO NOTE: Ronin toadin makes amazing link material, due to it lacking even a soft once per turn on its effect, but cant be used as a synchro summon.  If you use anemone as a combo extender, it restricts you to summoning anything but water types for the rest of the turn.  Nopepenguin can be used as synchro material to summon brave, and then immediately resummoned using its effect when brave pulls out a penguin soldier from the deck and then linked away into something powerful  There are ALOT of very very strong synergies and combo lines and it would be crazy to sit here and list all of them, and I dont have the patience to do it, but this guide doesnt even scratch the surface of the crazy turns you can do. Ive completed the "maxx C challenge" twice with this deck.  the deck doesnt play maxx c because of how resilient it is and how much card advantage it can create, but it loses to it. very very badly. because of that, we run 3 ash blossoms and two called by the grave.  gameciel is the kaiju we play because of the typing, and being able to summon him in m2 to deal with tribrigade stuff after locking yourself out of summons with anemone has won me at least a few games.  Gluttonous reptolphins recursion effect actually comes into play suprisingly often and is a really powerful card in his own right.  This is my first time ever writing a guide for literally anything so I apologize for any typos that may exist. I couldnt find a guide or a decklist for anything remotely close to what ive come up with here, so I figured I might as well make one myself. if you have any questions, feel free to bother me on discord with them at DapperCalf#3203.

deck_excerpt: (Master Duel) Budget Traptrix deck for climbing to Platinum and beyond.
deck_description:
Summary

This is the deck that I would build if I just started playing Master Duel. Many URs in this deck can be found in spacial packs. Others, except for Traptrix-specific cards, are staples that you'll have to craft anyway. This deck can get you through lower ranks very easily. You might have to upgrade it around Gold rank tho, (upgrade path provided below and is shown in side deck) The upgraded version of this deck, which I am using, is also doing not-so-bad in Platinum. I mean, let's be real, this is by no mean anywhere close to being meta but it is extremely fun to play :)

Upgrade Path

I really only added Utopia Double Engine for end-game purpose. Without them it is very hard to clear out monster with high ATK/DEF. But they are somewhat inconsistent IMO, because I draw Double or Nothing all the time (kekw). So The first thing I would consider is to replace them with something else. (though if you don't mine playing potentially brick card then they are totally fine to play. Here is an upgrade path (order does not matter, add what you think is more important) : Main Deck :
  1. Ash Blossom → x3
  2. + 2x Ice Dragon Prison (or x3) -- very good against Eldlich, Blue Eyes, etc.
  3. Solemn Judgement → x3 / Solemn Strike x2 -- even more negate
  4. Imperial Wall -- almost instant win against many decks.
  5. Pot of Prosperity → x3
  6. (Maxx "C") -- somewhat optional IMO
Extra deck :
  1. + AA-Zeus and the Zoodiac engine.
  2. + Accesscode Talker
  3. + Link Spider -- useful when you struck with Phantom Knight trap card and Parallel eXceed.
  4. Traptrix Sera → x3 -- optional
  5. Others staples -- honestly any good general rank 4 XYZ will do
    1. Bagooska
    2. Knightmare Unicorn
    3. Knightmare Pheonix
    4. Borrelsword Dragon
    5. Redoer
    6. etc.

deck_excerpt: A Swordsoul-Tenyi deck without the Swordsouls. The deck was used from Silver to high Gold with a good win rate against rouge decks.
deck_description: This deck is based off of a basic Swordsoul-Tenyi deck, but since there is no Swordsoul cards in Master Duel, there are no Swordsouls. Opening any 2 Tenyi monsters is enough to go for a Berserker of the Tenyi or higher depending on the hand. Changing the synchros is not recommended except for Adamancipator Risen - Dragite and Crimson Blader unless you are experienced. The deck wants to summon Tenyi Spirit - Sahasrara and any synchro or effect link monster. If you have a Crystron Halqifibrax on the field, you need to either use it for a higher link or summon a level 8 synchro to make Ruddy Rose Dragon during the opponents turn. The deck is weak to Maxx "C" and Nibiru, the Primal Being, but it can play around Tri-Brigade with an optimal hand and foresight. Shaman of the Tenyi is a pain to deal with for both you and the opponent, do not use it unless you are not planning on summoning a non-Tenyi from the extra deck for the rest of the turn. Do not use the graveyard effect of Virtual World Oto-Hime - Toutou without planning ahead since it locks you out of summoning Mare Mare tokens and Tenyi Spirit - Adhara for the rest of the turn. It is better to use its normal summon effect  at the beginning of the turn after summoning your Tenyi cards since there is no drawback. Definitely do not be afraid of normal summoning Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring if you need a level 3 tuner.   Replay can be seen at: https://youtu.be/p4W-0yoLWdg

deck_excerpt: Karakuri Synchro deck using the usual what every other Machine Synchro deck has been using for the last few years
deck_description: Youtube video is up. Link down below: ( https://youtube.com/watch?v=AGG-NBOueCs&feature=y) Karakuri has had an in and out running since it's inception in the 5Ds era and beyond in all forms, and hasn't stopped being Yu-Gi-Oh's LolCow ever since then (even since the new support dropped for it). While it isn't a bad archetype nor the ability to conjure effects based on how changing their On field position does anything (except for their Level 9 Synchro Monster anyways); the fact that cards like "Mecha Phantom Beast Enterblathnir" and the usual Auroradon shenanigans *(that every Machine Syncho deck fetishes over)* exist right now seems to help them slightly in the uphill battle. However while they can get these things, doesn't mean that they truly seek the nourishment that other machine synchro decks that outperform them in every compacity can (including the appromentioned Mecha Phantom Beast and even the numerous variants of Synchrons). One apparent weakness Karakuri does come across very often is the usual effect negators like Effect Veiler and Infinite Impermanence; and the common trope of "Ash Blossom and Joyous Spring". While I do attend to use Crossout Designator to do a variable amout of handling against these examples, Karakuri's still have too many disruptions, and not enough room in their arsenal for me to fit in all at once. On other other hand, what I do know is that Droll & Lock Bird and Artifact Lancea are also key players this format (alongside Artifact Scythe). Triple Tactics Talent is another piece for Karakuri to use as another backbone to allow them to force cards out of your opponents hands; force  monster confiscation from your opponents' side of the field; or allow you to draw 2 with no cost. Also included is the use of Solemn Strike if I want to make a pave way to focus on more of my side deck utilities, or for some reason the monster effects that are being dished against me become a little too "personal". Honestly I still have hope Karakuri can get the right tools it needs to become the truly functional deck it needs to be. Sure it doesn't have to stray out of it's out of the already memeish mechanic of "Cause and effect"; but the least we can see is more cards that allow effects that can benefits from the change of battle positions at any given moment; or maybe even a way to protect their non synchro Karakuri monsters from negations and field destruction. Also not to mention a Karakuri monster that could act as a vacuum that could return Karakuri effect monsters to the deck at the End Phase.

deck_name: Time Thief Zoodiac (easy solo mode deck)
deck_excerpt: Easy fast way to win Solo mode in Yugioh Master Duel.
deck_description: Easy way to grind Solo Mode, You just want to summon any zoodiac main deck monster (can be searched off of Fire Formation Tenki) and use the main deck monster to immediately summon any Zoodiac XYZ monster Zoodiacs break XYZ summoning rules since you can overlay any zoodiac xyz with just one zoodiac main deck monster (going First you want to end on Zoodiac Drident) Going second you want to summon XYZ Boarbow and attack directly then rank up boarbow with Chakrinine and then Tigermoarter and since an XYZ monster battled you can overlay a 3 matieral zoodiac into a 4 material AA-Zeus-SkyThunder. that can nuke the field at a quick effect speed. If you dont have a zoodiac try to make a rank 4 Time thief to inturpt their plays and if you do have zeus and Time Thief redooer you can Nuke with zeus chain redooer detatch a monster and your redoer with comeback next turn. Also you can OTK with Raiders Knight to make Arc Rebelion XYZ Dragon.

The basic strat is you put up a defensive Sky striker board turn one hopefully searching engage off of Shizuku and having a hand trap or two, then use your sky striker spells to stack counters on servant to combo off into accesscode and Mighty master for a ton of board pops and 8100 damage, less reliant on hayate for extra damage than vanilla striker and can end games faster with a bit more combo potential and ability to set up unique boards with endymion and the striker links that can be hard to get through. The deck is a bit bulky at 45 cards (its getting harder and harder to figure out what to cut) but despite that it is fairly consistant because of the amount of draw and search power the deck has access to. There are some choices in here that could be changed, the deck doesn't need halq nearly as much as vanilla striker because of souls and the endymion line making it much easier to get into selene so that and possibly the veiler could be cut for another extra deck slot. You could potentially cut the second selene as well, but it is very good in the deck and two feels a little more comfortable to me.

deck_excerpt: A Cyber Dragon OTK Deck with a bit of balance if you have to go first and many different ways to OTk
deck_description:
My Version of a Cyber Dragon OTK Deck. There are multiple ways to go for the OTK:
  1. Via Chimeratech Rampage Dragon. Make it with Power Bond, destroy the backrow and send 2 LIGHT Machines to the GY to have 3 Attacks with 4200. Can go to 6300 with Cyber Dragon Sieger or 8400 with Limiter Removal
  2. Make Nova via Cyber Dragon and Galaxy Soldier, Galaxy Soldier send Cyber Dragon Herz or Machine Duplication on Herz, Core or Nächster. Summon back 1 Cyber Dragon with Nova. From there you can go for Sieger to boost Nova to 4200 and then Nova can boost itself to 6300 by banishing Sieger. Or you just banish the CyDra with Nova and double it with Limiter Removal for 8400. Then in MP2 summon Infinity with it so it doesn't die. Or if you have another level 5 on the field you can make a 2nd Nova and summon back another CyDra from the GY.
  3. If your opponent has left a 0 DEF Monster/Token on the field you can just try to get 3 CyDras via Machine Duplication or Normal Summon Core, add Emergency, add Nächster or CyDra, send CyDra with Nächster, special summon CyDra from Grave via Nächster; then use Power Bond
  4. Swarm the field with CyDras via Machine Duplication, Nächster or Nova and then run over your opponent with Limiter Removal
  5. Use Overload Fusion or Cyberload Fusion to go for Chimeratech Overdragon with a lot of materials and then run over all your opponents monsters (works best if your opponent has a lot of Face-up attack position monsters or 1 face-up attack position monster that can't be destroyed by battle. Works even better if you have Power Bond or Limiter Removal
Those are the 5 ways I mostly use for OTKs. I decimate my opponents board usually with either Chimeratech Megafleet or Chimeratech Fortress, if they have applicable targets; or with Forbidden Droplet. Infinity is mostly there to either protect your OTK or to have at least something when you have to go first. You could also play Instant Fusion and Panzer Dragon for more level 5 material. TL;DR: Use Machine Duplication/Cyber Dragon Nova/Cyber Dragon Nächster to put CyDras on the field, cut the opponents field down to size with Imperm/Droplet or the Chimeratechs, get high damage on board with Nova/Power Bond/Limiter Removal/Sieger, pick the right bossmonster for the job (Overdragon for a full field, End Dragon for a weak defender or Crooked Cook, Rampage and Twin Dragon for a semifull field with 1-2 Monsters, Nova and Sieger or a CyDra Swarm for a nearly empty field) if you have to go first/can't OTK use Infinity and or Cyber Dragon Enternal(if you get a machine-fusion in the grave) for some protection and pray

deck_excerpt: A healthy mix of Plant engine, Invoked engine, and Aroma archetype to make your health high and their health low.
deck_description: This deck makes use of a combination of cards, namely "Blessed Winds" and "Aromaseraphy Jasmine" to run an effective Aroma archetype that is able to ladder up to "Shooting Quasar Dragon," while also having a potent Invoked engine, with the likes of "Invoked Mechaba" being able to come out if omni-negates are needed, or "Invoked Purgatrio" to bulldoze the opponent's full board. The ideal turn 1 with an Aroma focus will end with "Aromaseraphy Jasmine" on the field in the Extra Monster Zone, pointing toward "Aromaseraphy Sweet Marjoram," with "Blessed Winds" set on the field after drawing it from the first effect of "Aromaseraphy Sweet Marjoram." This allows turn 2 to start with the activation of "Blessed Winds" at your earliest convenience, either gaining LP by shuffling the plant monsters in your graveyard for a more marginal LP lead, or paying 1000 LP to bring "Aromage Marjoram" onto the field in the other slot connected to "Aromaseraphy Jasmine," affording all three monsters basic immunities to destruction by battle (via "Aromaseraphy Jasmine,") battle damage (via "Aromage Marjoram,") and targeted effects (via "Aromaseraphy Sweet Marjoram.") Concerning the combo for "Shooting Quasar Dragon," the minimum amount of on-field monsters required to summon it is "Aromaseraphy Sweet Marjoram," "Crystron Halqifibrax," and one level 1 non-tuner monster (usually this is "Aromage Laurel" due to its ease of being brought onto the field thanks to being able to be Special Summoned from the hand when you have the LP lead, but this can also be "Evil Thorn" in a pinch.) With "Crystron Halqifibrax," you use its primary effect to Special Summon "Steam Synchron" from either your hand or deck, and then Synchro Summon "Old Entity Hastorr" with "Steam Synchron" and the level 1 non-tuner. After passing the turn, during your opponent's main phase, you use the second effect of "Crystron Halqifibrax" to Special Summon "Formula Synchron" from the Extra Deck. Then, as soon as possible, use the second effect of "Formula Synchron" to Synchro Summon "Shooting Quasar Dragon" using "Formula Synchron," "Old Entity Hastorr," and "Aromaseraphy Sweet Marjoram."

deck_name: DPE Sky Striker feat. Underworld Goddess
deck_excerpt: Yes, DPE and Accesscode count as Waifus, deal with it.
deck_description: Typical Sky Striker game plan of cycling your links and recycling your spells until you have enough advantage your opponent can't recover their momentum. My locals isn't hyper competitive and I'm not expecting the Brave Engine to be represented in any meaningful capacity so I'm choosing to side deck the Ogres and main deck the Nibirus.  DPE isn't as consistent as he was when FD was at 3, but he's still a good option for most match ups and I'm choosing not to run Verte due to how tight the Extra Deck is, and how devastating it is to have him get negated and have no follow up.  I'm also choosing to use the Charmer Climb instead of the Halq Climb due to it being the more resilient to interruption and out of fear that Halq is finally on the verge of being banned. Hiita also allows the teching of Underworld Goddess, who can win games that Accesscode might not be able to.
