deck_excerpt: 10 years playing Koa'ki Meiru. This is my Magnum Opus.
deck_description: I'm Plat 3 on Master Duel with a similar build. I've been playing Koa'ki Meiru for 10 years.  Basic combo: Summon Urnight, reveal Iron Core to summon Supplier, search Maximus (Urnight if Maximus is already in hand), (if monster in grave) XYZ Number 60, (if not) Link Bujin and then make Number 60, summon Urnight from GY with Number 60, reveal Iron Core to summon Tornado (save your Suppliers just in case), XYZ Dark Rebellion, put Vesp on top of Number 60, summon Maximus from hand.  Combo 2: Special summon Alpha, summon Urnight, reveal Iron Core to summon Tornado, Alpha returns Urnight to hand to return opponent's monster, Link Tri-Brigade girl, summon Urnight from hand with Tri-Brigade, summon Supplier with Urnight, XYZ Number 60, summon Urnight from GY with Number 60, reveal Iron Core to summon Supplier, search Maximus, XYZ Dark Rebellion, Vesp on top of Number 60, summon Maximus from hand.  There are many different ways to go about this combo with Summoner Monk or Tin Goldfish + Supplier in hand. The main idea is to spam Urnight 2 or even 3 times if possible. You won't always be able to end up with that exact field on the board but you will still be able to OTK. You at times can end up with Vesp, Rebellion, Bujin, and Tornado on field which is exactly 8000 while Tornado destroys ALL their special summoned monsters.  I recently was also able to create Lambda while my opponent had a monster on field ready to activate an effect, negated it with Gamma, made level 8 Synchro, summoned Maximus from hand, pop card, Link Bujin, XYZ Number 60, and comboed my way to an OTK field (1500 + 2500 + 2500 + 1700).  Left Arm Offering opens the door to adding Leviair and 2 level 3 monsters to banish your Urnight and search for Iron Core and then make the OTK combo but Left Arm Offering is just a test card for now. You can definitely remove it.  You can also add 3 or 2 Parallel Exceed and add 2 or 3 Trade-In for more combo potential + draw power.

deck_excerpt: Fun, experimental Wind-Up deck using a small Crusadia engine.
deck_description: This is an extremely experimental deck and can often brick, so if anyone has any suggestions, i'd love to try them out.  The main game plan is to get to your Wind-Up magician, Wind-Up shark combo as fast as possible; hence all the draw cards.  From there, you'll be able to loop magician and shark, along with rat and the link 2 Wind-Up monster.  After that it's up to the rest of your hand, the rank 3's are surprisingly useful for your endboard and you should usually finish on a 2 negate apollosa, cicada king, and toad. You can also do a small hand loop with hunter but it isn't too crazy.  The crusadia engine is merely for extension and in other cases where you brick. It ensures that you can at least end on an Equimax negate which is better than nothing.  Anyways, I hope you guys enjoy the deck!

deck_excerpt: Harp is not banned so......................... Enjoy a 1 card combo = 8 disruptions
deck_description:
Orcust is one of my most favorite Deck of all time, seeing Harp at 1 in Master Duel really made me excited and immediately build Orcust Striker as my 1st Deck in Master Duel. However, after discovering the power of Normal Summon Scrap Recycler, I immediately scrap those Striker cards and put some scrap cards instead. After some testing, I found that the best end board I could make with just Normal Summon Scrap Recycler 0 extenders is: 3 materials Apollousa, Bardiche, 2 Fog Blades, I:P Masquerena, and Babel with Dingirsu on GY. In total those are 8 disruptions

Combo

  1. Normal Summon Recycler -> Send Rosenix/O-lion for a token
  2. Link into Scrap Wyvern -> Set 1 card
  3. Scrap Wyvern Summon back Recycler and pop it -> Triggers to summon Golem from Deck, then pop the Set card
  4. Golem Summon back Recycler -> Send World Wand
  5. Link into Lib with Recycler and Golem -> Set World Legacy Succession -> Bring back Golem -> Bring back Recycler -> Send Harp
  6. Link into 3 materials Apollousa using Scrap Wyvern and any other 2 monsters (which monsters don't matter)
  7. Banish Harp to Summon Orcustrated Knightmare
  8. Link Orcustrated Knightmare and 1 monster into Galatea -> Shuffle Harp to Set Babel
  9. Banish Orcustrated Knightmare to Send Skeleton
  10. Banish World Wand to Summon back Orcustrated Knightmare
  11. Link Galatea and Orcustrated Knightmare into Bardiche -> Send Cloak to Set Fog Blade
  12. Banish Cloak to add Boots -> Summon Boots
  13. Banish Skeleton to Summon back Galatea -> Xyz into Dingirsu -> Attach Skeleton (send to GY if you go 2nd)
  14. Link Dingirsu and Boots into Masquerena (DON'T SUMMON ON THE ZONE BARDICHE POINTS TO)
  15. Banish Boots to add Fog Blade
During your opponent's turn, you can:
  1. Banish Skeleton to Summon back Dingirsu (to a zone Bardiche points to) -> Dingirsu cl1 Bardiche cl2 -> pop + send to GY
  2. Link Masquerena and Dingirsu into Unicorn (you can co-link it with Bardiche pog) to shuffle 1 card
  3. Banish Orcustrated Knightmare to send World Wand, Apollousa can gain 800 ATK for 1 more negate (and yes this is a Damage Step card)
  4. Banish Orcustrated Knightmare to send Harp -> End Phase Harp Summon Orcustrated Knightmare for Accesscode next turn + Orcustrated Knightmare can send Skeleton to bring back Dingirsu

Deck Breakdown (Outside Combo)

Main Deck:
  1. 3x Scrap Raptor: Search Recycler (add + Extra Normal Summon)
  2. 3x Fossil Dig: Search Scrap Raptor
  3. 3x Scrapyard: Search Scrap Raptor
  4. 2x Scrap Lube: Revive Recycler
  5. 2x Overdone Burial: Revive Recycler
  6. 3x Shade Brigandine: Extender. If recycler got negated, just Brigandine into Scrap Wyvern and do your combo normally
  7. 1x Orcust Crescendo: Omni-negate, a bit hard to use since you won't control Galatea most of the time
  8. 10x Other Staples you already know about
Extra Deck:
  1. 1x Al'miraj: This boi is important. If Recycler got ashed, veilered, impermed, or whatever; you can Link into Al'miraj and revive back your Recycler using cards like Monster Reborn, Scrap Lube, or Overdone Burial. It doesn't matter if it's negated, the first send is only to set up 2 monsters on the field for Scrap Wyvern. If you happened to Monster Reborn it, you can make 4 materials Apollousa instead
  2. 1x Longirsu: Quick Effect potential non-targeting send 2 monsters to GY. It's an Orcust Link Monster, which enables Crescendo
  3. 1x Trisbaena: Link Masquerena and Apollousa to banish all backrow (including your Fog Blades). You can trigger its effect by using Harp or Skeleton. Only do this against backrow Decks. Since most backrow Deck barely have a monster on the field, you can sacrifice Apollousa and your Fog Blades to banish up to 5 backrow
  4. 1x Barricadeborg: Protect your Babel. You can Link this instead of Masquerena if you're afraid of Lightning Storm/Twin Twister wiping your Babel
  5. 1x Link Spider: Rosenix and O-lion Summon a token, in case you ever need to turn them into effect monsters to do some Link plays

Conclusions

How consistent is the Deck? 12 Starters in 48 card Deck, so around 78% chance to open your Starter. Playing 2 ofs most of the combo pieces to avoid drawing garnet = can't combo, also it's an Orcust Deck, you can't just play 1 of. Playing more backrow staples over hand traps because Scrap Wyvern fodder is important to make Apollousa. Don't ever, not even once, think on playing Maxx "C" on this Deck, it will hurt you more than gaining advantage The Deck biggest weakness is pretty much Nibiru, since you go into Apollousa at your 10th Summon. This Deck can dodge Ash, Veiler/Imperm, or even Droll. Unless your opponent is smart enough to negate Scrap Wyvern instead of just YEP BUTTONS and negate Recycler, you're fine if you have an Extender. If your Scrap Wyvern got negated, you're screwed. You can still make some play if you have a way to send Harp to GY. The funny part is that Droll only affect Bardiche engine alone. Where does it say "Add" on an Orcust card? Even the Scrap engine doesn't add, except for the RotA I guess. Even Lib doesn't add, she SETS. Actually you're screwed if you got Drolled on Fossil Dig/Scrapyard. But who plays Droll on Bo1 anyways (I guess Drytron hater does) This Deck also suffers from not having an Omni-Negate, meaning that Raigeki/Lightning Storm alone may break the board. Unless you decided to just say NOPE to Babel and Set Crescendo instead, which mean you're gonna miss a lot of advantage just for an Omni-Negate. No Masquerena, no Dingirsu, no Harp during your opponent's turn. No worries tho, Raigeki alone can't break the board. You still have 2 Fog Blades (which can revive Bardiche BTW) and Dingirsu. On the other hand, this Deck doesn't instantly lose to Droplet/Dark Ruler like that Tier 1 Machine Deck that everyone hates Overall, this Deck is kinda decent. Unlike most Combo Deck that sets up like 7 Negates and loses to Droplet, this Deck sets up a different type of disruptions. An interactive one, that is. Playing with Masquerena and Dingirsu is much more fun than just negating everything your opponent does (tho the Deck still sets up 5 monster negates). Kinda balanced when it comes to monsters and backrow. My build is obviously not the best one out there, I don't even put Ash in it, which is kinda questionable. Maybe because I prefer board breakers over hand traps? The satisfaction is just not the same. You can always swap out cards in any way you like it, don't just copy paste Deck from the internet raw, you insolent fools!
Will edit later

deck_excerpt: Spam your opponent with birds ruin their plays then crack back with leathal when able
deck_description: Go into Number F0: Utopic Draco Future and Apollousa, Bow of the Goddess and set Tri-Brigade revolt turn 1. turn 2 if able make zues with as many materials as possible and clean up house.

So as a quick introduction, my name is Leo and I've been playing this deck since 2018- yes, before Sisters of the Rose came out and they actually got good. While I can't claim anything too impressive, I regularly placed well with them at my locals until tiger got yeeted out of existence. I've seen a few Lunalight lists on here and they are regularly pretty disappointing. Probably the best way to play the deck is Lunalight Tri-Brigade, but I haven't done all too much experimenting with that. 

Overview

Lunalights (if you're not familiar) are a powerful fusion OTK deck released during the pendulum era. This deck uses an infinite negate combo with Mist Valley Apex Avian to go first and hopefully completely lock your opponent out of playing the game, with your incredible OTK power ensuring a kill on the clapback.

Card by Card

Main Deck 1x Tri-Brigade Fraktall - Honestly just filler. You could definitely replace this with something else if you wanted. A Foolish Burial, third Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring, a Nibiru, the Primal Being, or a backup copy of Lunalight Wolf would be my suggestions. 1x Lunalight Wolf - Miracle Fusion! Who doesn't love miracle fusion? I know I do, especially in a deck that can dump materials as easy as this one 3x Lunalight Kaleido Chick - One of the two biggest cards in this deck. On the field, can send ANY Lunalight monster from your deck OR extra deck to the GY as COST. The actual effect of being able to use that monster's name if used for a fusion summon honestly rarely comes up, so just laugh at your opponent whenever they use a negate on this effect. It also turns off your opponent's ability to interact in the BP of the turn that it's banished in. She really just does everything. 1x Lunalight Emerald Bird - One of the more eh cards in the deck, but I still think it's worth having at one, especially if you play Foolish Burial. At worst, she's another monster you can send off of Kaleido Chick to use for a fusion summon.  2x Lunalight Yellow Martin - Another fantastic card. Bounces a Lunalight card you control to special summon itself from hand or GY. It banishes itself when it leaves the field then, but you can avoid this by using it as XYZ material. 3x my literal actual child Lunalight Tiger - Along with Kaleido Chick, one of the best 2 cards in the deck. Her pendulum effect special summons a Lunalight monster from your gy but negates their effects. Reminder that Kaleido Chick foolishes a monster for cost, and not as an effect. Lunalight Tiger's pendulum effect also isn't a hard OPT, so if you bounce her, (cough cough martin cough cough) you can use the effect again. 1x Lunalight Black Sheep - Not a very good card, but useful for a combo to get Lunalight Wolf into your hand 3x Fire Formation – Tenki - Beast-warrior ROTA. 'nough said 3x Allure of Darkness - Draw Power. 'nough said. 1x Lunalight Fusion - a fusion spell that lets you use one material from your deck or extra deck if your opponent has a monster special summoned from the extra deck. comes up sometimes, but it's mainly just searchable off of Yellow Martin 3x Foolish Burial Goods - used to send the next 2 cards to the gy 3x Luna Light Perfume - Monster reborn in the streets hand, archetypal search in the sheets gy. (note Luna (SPACE) Light) 1x Lunalight Serenade Dance - Perfume gy eff, but the card in hand is sent as an effect and it special summons a monster instead of adding it to hand 1x Blackwing – Zephyros the Elite - martin, but once per duel, and you get to it differently 1x Raidraptor – Singing Lanius - special summons itself from hand if you have an xyz monster 1x Mist Valley Thunderbird - the "infinite" in "infinite negates" 1x Mist Valley Apex Avian - the "negates" in "infinite negates" 3x Maxx "C" - 2x Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring - 2x Called by the Grave - 3x Crossout Designator - You could probably lean into this harder by playing a larger variety of staples to negate or cut it entirely. Player preference Extra Deck 2x Lunalight Leo Dancer - It's ya girl, the big cat, the dommy mommy, thunder thighs the thunder cat, kill your opponent real good. Untargetable, indestructible, 3500 double attacker that nukes your opponent's special summoned monsters after her first attack 1x Lunalight Sabre Dancer - Untargetable big number, but doesn't matter all that much for that. the REAL reason you play this is because you can send it off of chick turn one and then banish it from your gy turn 3 to give Lunalight Leo Dancer a huge 3k boost to make sure they die 1x Lunalight Panther Dancer - the material for Lunalight Leo Dancer. send it off of kaleido chick and then use wolf to miracle fusion. you can also use kaleido's effect to take its name or just use the effect of Lunalight Fusion to send it, but most frequently you will just be sending it with kaleido and then using wolf to miracle. 1x Divine Arsenal AA-ZEUS – Sky Thunder - Zeus is good, but I haven't summoned it much in this deck, so you could take it out if you wanted and replace it with something like Tornado Dragon or a second Panther Dancer. Number 41: Bagooska the Terribly Tired Tapir is also not that bad of a choice. Fire Fighting Daruma Doll is another good card. 1x Brotherhood of the Fire Fist – Tiger King - mainly useful because it searches tenki if you didn't start with it. also useful because it negates the effects of all monsters on the field except beast warriors 1x Primathmech Laplacian - This card is filler. I think I've summoned it once? It was cool when I did, but should probably be replaced. 1x Number 60: Dugares the Timeless - Amazing utility card. Useful as a generic xyz monster and all of the effects are great in this deck. I've used all of them at some point. Just probably don't want to use the the special summon effect on turn one. 1x Raidraptor – Force Strix - generic xyz monster that searches singing lanius or zephyros (usually singing). used in the deck's main combo 1x Borrelsword Dragon - Big dragon big number big beatstick go brrrr. you could probably play Accesscode Talker instead if you wanted, but I play Borrelsword in all of my decks almost because I'm salty about buying it when it was $90. 1x Apollousa, Bow of the Goddess - It's a pretty common and Clear sight to see her bow on your opponent's board with 24-32k attack. It's just a good card and if you're worried about your opponent disrupting you with monster effects, it's great to make, though you usually can't afford to on turn one. It's a card that you could cut, but it's far from bad. 1x Simorgh, Bird of Sovereignty - The deck's namesake. For 3 points of link material, only one of which has to be a winged beast, this powerful boss monster will let you special summon Apex Avian from your deck while giving both of them targeting protection. Just make sure that you don't have more than 3 spell/trap zones in use or you won't be able to summon Apex Avian. 1x Raidraptor – Wise Strix - Great for link climbing and used in the deck's main combo. special summons zephyros from deck to extend combos 1x Union Carrier - equips Mist Valley Thunderbird from your deck for the infinite negates 1x Tri-Brigade Ferrijit the Barren Blossom - good for link climbing, but could be replaced if you wanted to.  Notes Brotherhood of the Fire Fist – Eagle and Brotherhood of the Fire Fist – Buffalo are a strong and quick link climbing package. I don't think that this deck needs them, and it does take up space in the main deck, but if you want a more pure build of Lunalights, they're fantastic for climbing into Apollusa or other link 4s Ghost Belle & Haunted Mansion is a personal favorite for this deck because of its weakness to called by. I just didn't think I had the room with the other hand staples I wanted to run (aka Maxx "C" and ways to turn off Maxx "C").

Main Combo + Synergies

The main combo starts with Lunalight Tiger and Lunalight Kaleido Chick in hand. Normal summon Kaleido Chick and use its effect to send Lunalight Yellow Martin from your deck to the GY. Activate Lunalight Tiger in your pendulum zone and use its effect to bring back Yellow Martin. Overlay Yellow Martin and Kaleido Chick into Raidraptor - Force Strix and detach Yellow Martin to activate the effect of Force Strix, searching Raidraptor - Singing Lanius. Special summon Singing Lanius from your hand and link Force Strix and Singing Lanius into Raidraptor - Wise Strix. Wise Strix's effect should special summon Blackwing - Zephyros the Elite from your deck. It can't be used as link material, so we have to use it for an xyz first. Activate the effect of Yellow Martin in grave, bouncing Lunalight Tiger to special summon itself. Overlay Zephyros and Martin into Number 60: Dugares the Timeless (although any xyz monster with an effect you can activate to detach a material should work). Activate the effect of your xyz monster, detaching Zephyros. Activate the Lunalight Tiger you bounced with Martin and use it to special summon Kaleido chick. Use Kaleido Chick to dump Lunalight Sabre Dancer for next turn. Then use the effect of Zephyros to once again bounce Tiger, special summoning Zephyros. Use Wise Strix and Dugares (or whatever xyz monster you made) to go link into Simorgh, Bird of Sovereignty and use Kaleido Chick and Zephyros to link into Union Carrier. Use Union Carrier's effect targeting Simorgh to equip Mist Valley Thunderbird from deck. During your end phase, special summon Mist Valley Apex Avian with Simorgh's effect. Make sure to summon it to a zone Simorgh points to so that it gains targeting protection. Now whenever your opponent activates a card effect, activate Apex Avian, targeting your Thunderbird, which will special summon itself whenever it returns to your hand. This is far from failproof. Apex Avian is only once per chain, so if your opponent has any quick effects, they can chain them after Apex Avian without you being able to stop them. There's also the ever-present Dark Ruler No More and Forbidden Droplet, which you won't be able to respond to. If you need to get Lunalight Wolf into your hand, send it off of Kaleido Chick, then make Tiger King to search tenki, tenki to search black sheep, and use black sheep's effect to return wolf to your hand. Other synergies in the deck are that you can chain your Serenade Dance/Luna Light Perfumes if you have several in your hand. Simply activate one graveyard effect and discard/send the next card you want to use. You can also use this to put Martin or Zephyros in your GY if you have them. You can also search Zephyros off of Force Strix if you need to. Dugares is of course another way you can get things from your hand to your gy, and Dugares actually discards as part of the effect, rather than the cost, so if you send yellow martin or emerald bird, you will be sending them to the gy by a card effect.

Closing Thoughts

In closing, I love this deck a lot, and while it definitely has its weaknesses, being able to full combo off of two very searchable cards is incredibly fun and the deck has a lot more tools to extend than that. It's also an incredibly strong deck when it comes to playing through negates, and on the ranked latter it feels like no one actually knows where you're supposed to hit this deck.

You can lock with cook or mystic mine, but not usually both.  You will need to decide how you want to use your deck thinning before committing to one path over the other.  After you have determined what your opponent is playing, and what you will want to use your ghost-reaper package for, you can safely banish most of your extra deck with pot of extravagance.
Pure PSY-Frame as of Feb 2022.
Mayakashi Shiranui. Full video: https://youtu.be/oA4HJwIBO6Q

deck_excerpt: Blind second, stop your opponent's combo with handtraps, kaiju their monsters, blow up their backrow, get your field spell, win the game (ideally anyw
deck_description: Backrow removal is high priority here, if you can afford Lightning Storms and play them instead of Twin Twisters you will almost exclusively be using the duster effect to clear the way to lethal. Most of the time you need your opponent to have at least 1 monster with 2000+ atk on board to OTK, which your kaijus can help you with. It is possible to OTK on an empty board, just a little tougher, you have to hard draw Limiter Removal, which Memories of Hope can help with. If not you can attack for 4k with your gates, then MP2 make Sunya to burn for 3k in next standby then either attack for game or style on them with a Lava Golem for the last 1000. Handtrap line-up is a little tricky. Ash is an auto-include in basically any deck these days. Imperm's versatility of being able to slow down an opponent's combo or be set as a line of defense when forced to go first or in instances where you can't OTK is invaluable. The Gammas should ideally be used defensively to protect a search with Planet Pathfinder or Terraforming, getting to make Omega and rip a card is just a cheeky bonus. Nibiru is crazy but the fact that it summons itself conflicts with the Numeron combo since you need an empty field for it to resolve so it can't be recommended here. If you're on Master Duel I don't have to tell you to jam 3 Maxx C in here. The deck has some niche interactions that can be game winning or game losing if you don't play around them. Lava Golem (and Sphere Mode) both take your normal summon, this can sometimes leave you having to choose whether to tribute off your opponent's board or get your field spell with Planet Pathfinder, sad times. Numeron Wall is the MVP of this deck. It flat-out ignores Ash Blossom by activating Network from deck. It also has a Battle Fader style effect, which does require you to take at least 1 attack, so it can't save you from one-shot situations but it can punish people sequencing attacks in the traditional "lowest attack first" way (thank you Gorz). If it's your only monster on the field you can also tribute it from the field to activate a Network from deck. If your opponent pops your Network on their turn to avoid getting burned by Sunya, you can also use Wall to get it back before your turn so that Sunya can resolve properly. Extra deck is pretty self-explanatory. You got yer gates and a tool box of big generic links to make in MP2 if you haven't won the game already. Sidedeck is where things get spicy. This board aims to do what the Gren Maju decks tried to do when forced to go first, just a little bit better. You have your 1-for-1 swaps of solid generic going 2nd cards in things like Red Reboot, and Sphere Mode. The rest of the sidedeck are floodgates that are purely 1-sided. Summon Limit seems bad considering the main combo requires summoning 4 monsters, but the effect of Numeron Calling is treated as only 1 summon. You can even use your second summon for Sunya or one of your big link monsters. Slifer seems like an insane include, but it had previously seen some success mained in earlier versions of this deck. It's a walking floodgate that gets huge courtesy of Memories of Hope and it can be summoned by tributing off 3 of your gates provided you haven't normal summoned yet. Torrential Tribute is Torrential Tribute. If you go on the Sunya line, you're ending on an empty board already, otherwise you're most likely sitting on 1 monster, having this up your sleeve for when your opponent over-extends is more often than not worth losing that 1 monster. Don't literally put Torrential Tribute up your sleeve, that's cheating. The deck is really straightforward and a ton of fun to play. I've been laddering on Master Duel with a slightly different version and the only match-ups I've had any trouble with are Drytron and some of the Tri-Brigade variants, but that's to be expected when facing tier-1 decks.
BANISHING

Springans while one of my favorite Albaz story decks are kind of booty but I still enjoy playing them a lot.     The goal of the deck is to have merrymaker out alongside a Sargas that way you have a free pop and if you have at least two materials on Merrymaker and you use the cards ability to banish you send off either sprind or Titaniklad to get their ability off.  Sprind- Add or special summon a Springans or Albaz monster from your deck  Titaniklad- Add or Special summon a Dogmatika or Albaz from your deck.     The best way to get sargas out aside from Sprind is to use the grave ability of Brothers when you send it off for a cost of say Gold Golganda or Merrymaker.  With Sanga ability you can banish him and one other springan monster you re add a springan to your hand. So you pretty much if you re add brothers can loop him (though it is a hard once per turn)  Another funny thing you can do with the deck is to loop Brothers using Rocky (though like I said it is a hard once per turn so if you can pull off the loop it is super mega haha funny)  Another thing. All springans have the ability that (hard) once per turn you can attach itself to a Springans XYZ monster on the field which is good to help fuel the banish ability of Merrymaker and of course their big finisher boss monster EXBLOWER which by detaching ANY number of materials from it can just blow up your opponents field, columns, etc. It is super mega ultra HAHAHA funny. If you attach a sargas to any of the XYZ monsters you give them an extra 1000 atk.  In conclusion, Springans are fun but they need a LOT of help and I hope Konami does that soon (maybe after dimension force) but I doubt it will happen because it seems like Konami wants to just keep making branded cards and new Albaz forms. I do have hope that in the final fight of the story they just give every deck in that story new stuff (maybe even a corrupted Despia version of ecclesia) but only time will tell. Thank you and have a nice day, morning or night.

When you think of the "Heroes" in Yugioh, what is the first thing that comes to your mind? For most it would be a card like Neos, Celestial, Dasher, etc. If I asked what do you think about when I mention OG Heroes/Iconic Heroes most modern players would probably say Neos, Dark Law (Not an OG hero but still an iconic Hero Boss monster), etc. Well when I think of an iconic Hero Boss monster I think of the Elemental Hero branch and instantly think about Flame Wingman who imo is THE Elemental Hero Boss Monster and THE most iconic Hero boss card and monster right alongside Stratos.     This build is meant to shit out the different Hero fusions while looking cool as hell doing so. I hope you enjoy the deck and maybe even build your own Hero deck using your favorite Hero monster(s) in there no matter how hard or easy it is to bring out.  Yes, I do use Skyscraper in the deck because it is meant to be a season 1 Jaden/Judai Yuki deck because I love the og Elemental Hero monsters and skyscraper can be a busted card and I just fell in love with the deck when it was used on me by a friend when I was at his house a few months ago and just knew I wanted to build the deck BECAUSE it is season 1 Elemental Heroes.  The later version of the deck uses the new Neos/Wingman fusion but since it is not on here it will have to wait.

deck_excerpt: A simple Synchro focused deck that revolves around Jack Atlas' ace monster, Red Dragon Archfiend and his Resonators.
deck_description: Hi, Grayewick the Fusionist here, back with one of the decks that I've been considering in preparation for the Synchro Festival, alongside Blackwings and Synchrons, and one that I actually personally like despite being a Synchro deck, presenting Resonators. As per usual, the side deck will be filled with cards that you might want to consider but are not necessarily mandatory for the build. Okay so, I wanna preface this "guide" with, of all the Yu-Gi-Oh! deuteragonists (aka the "Seto Kaiba" of each series) out there, Jack Atlas is probably one of my favorites, only bested by Reiji Akaba of Yu-Gi-Oh! ARC-V and followed by Ryoken Kogami of Yu-Gi-Oh! VRAINS, and Red Nova Dragon is my favorite Synchro Monster of all time just in terms of the art work. Okay, enough fanboying, let's actually proceed to the list. The Main Deck: • x3 Ascator, Dawnwalker & x2 Fire Ant Ascator - This is just a free generic Level 8 Synchro enabler without spending your Normal Summon, much like how Supay, Duskwalker is for the Level 6 Synchros which is another way to access Red Rising Dragon, but we already have something for that and I'm not really a fan of overlaps. I have seen some lists that runs x2 Fire Ant Ascator instead, just to make the other copy of Ascator, Dawnwalker live but that's only because they also run Chaos Ruler, the Chaotic Magical Dragon, in case they mill it off of its effect, which I personally don't think is the best way to approach this. • x3 Psi-Reflector, x2 Assault Sentinel, x1 Assault Beast & x2 Assault Mode Activate - This one's just a more compact version of an Assault Mode engine. Assault Sentinel used to be at 3 but I decided to cut it down because I'm already playing x2 Emergency Teleport, and often I find myself bricking with the extra copy of it, and it's searchable anyway. • x3 Resonator Command - This one I rarely see on some Resonator lists. It's not mandatory, but more of an additional consistency piece. You could play your blow out staples here if you want, like Lightning Storm or Twin Twisters to help you go second, Kaijus, or even Infinite Impermanence. I just chose it because I hate being Ashed. • x2 Red Reign - If only this card was searchable, oh boy. This card is really great against decks that swarm a lot. It's non-targeting, non-destruction removal, it also provides protection, it recycles itself, it's so good in tandem with your main boss monster Red Supernova Dragon. The Extra Deck: • x1 Psy-Framelord Omega - This one is just a filler slot, really, but if I were to place something here I would definitely wanna try out adding one more copy of Assault Mode Activate in the main and use Stardust Dragon (if I have it) for Stardust Dragon/Assault Mode since it's just a free omni negate. • x3 Red Rising Dragon - Your go-to Level 6 Synchro. You'll usually make this with Crimson Resonator and Wandering King Wildwind. Very rarely do you often use Assault Sentinel or Assault Beast for this, but it does come up. • x2 Scarlight Red Dragon Archfiend, x1 Hot Red Dragon Archfiend, x1 Red Dragon Archfiend - This slot could be for any DARK Dragon Synchro monsters you want/could use, or just any ratio of the said cards you wanna play. If I were to cut something it'd probably be either Hot Red Dragon Archfiend because it sucks for not treating itself as "Red Dragon Archfiend" or the original Red Dragon Archfiend because it could sometimes mess up your own cards if you're not mindful especially when going 1st, most likely the former. • x1 Red Supernova Dragon - Your main boss monster, also your largest beat stick. You would usually end up with it having 6000 ATK. It has a good destruction effect protection, a non-targeting, non-destruction mass removal. It's your main response to activated removal or just monster effect in general. You'll rarely use its effect during the Battle Phase, but it's nice to have. • x1 Red Nova Dragon - Your secondary boss monster, also your second largest beat stick. Also has a good enough destruction effect protection, and it's your main response to your opponent's beat sticks, in case they happen to be able to summon a monster with an ATK higher than 6000. • x1 Hot Red Dragon Archfiend King Calamity and x1 Tyrant Red Dragon Archfiend - These two are sort of tied, but are used for different purposes. Hot Red Dragon Archfiend King Calamity is a more aggressive pick and something you'd wanna go with going second due to its effect similar to D/D/D Duo-Dawn King Kali Yuga, and Tyrant Red Dragon Archfiend is the more defensive one, with its weird but useful Battle Phase exclusive Spell/Trap card negation. It's almost like a very budget version of Red-Eyes Dark Dragoon without the immunity effects, • x2 Hot Red Dragon Archfiend Bane - One of your avenues to Synchro climbing, albeit requiring battling much like the next one. Regardless, it's a 3500 ATK beater, which is not a joke, especially when it can revive any of your "Red Dragon Archfiend" monsters, including King Calamity. • x1 Hot Red Dragon Archfiend Abyss - Your walking 3200 ATK Infinite Impermanence. People used to abuse this with Guardragon Agarpain by cheesing it out of the Extra Deck. Testing and Closing Thoughts It definitely is consistent. You have a lot of 1-2 card combos in the deck that does not xeno lock you into anything that will hinder your game plan in any way, which means your choke points only vary based on your starting hand. If not for the presence of Maxx "C", I would definitely just swap it out for Ash Blossom & Joyous Springs and Crossout Designators instead to add a layer of protection. It has a simple and straightforward game plan and does not really need any sort of finesse or messing around with mind games unlike most meta decks that requires you to think steps ahead of your opposition. It knows what it does, and it does it very well. I'm actually convinced that this archetype's already complete. If you have any questions or thoughts, feel free to express them down in the comments and I'll respond to them as soon as I possibly can. Edit: I've decided that in the final iteration of the list to actually go in on the Assault Mode package just because Stardust Dragon/Assault Mode's omni negation is just extremely valuable and I just cannot pass up the opportunity to have extra coverage.

deck_description: Easy to play deck. Use Danger! and Dark World effects to destroy opponent's cards and summon as many high level monsters as you can. You can use Galaxy Wizard to Normal Summon level 8 or get Galaxy Queen's Light to change all your monsters to the same level. You can use Astral Kuriboh to give your XYZ Number monster protection from destruction. With Astral Kuriboh and Galaxy Queen's Light you can even summon Number 92, so you could Special Summon it from GY if it gets destroyed (negated on the field and then destroyed)  Just summon Number 97 and use it to summon 92 or 38.  If you go 1st, it's good to summon 92. If you play against Eldlich, you won, as you will just banish everything they set and on your turn summon Number 100 for 18k damage.  Edited version to add Synchro. With just Zombie + any lvl 4 on field you can go into Beelze that can attack twice.

deck_excerpt: Yep Rocks do Rock things with a single UR in the Main Deck (besides Staples). Most ED cards are Staples too!
deck_description: Note regarding UR's: ● The Main Deck is very cheap aside from staples which are cuttable. ● The Extra Deck contains lot of Stapes too and is Flexible. Caution: Even though floodgates are run, you need brainpower to play this deck! The Deck aims to end on Vanity's Ruler or Barrier Statue of the Drought (Only possible if you do not have to Normal Summon a Manju/Senju to combo) and plans to OTK turn 3. Sadly Magician of Black Chaos MAX does not exist in Master Duel, so this can't be used as backup strat in case you have to Normal Summon a Manju/Senju. Instead you end on either: ● Number 41 (against most decks) ● Dweller + Herald of Mirage Lights (slaughters drytron) ● Nephthys, the sacred flame (slaughters Sky Striker and other decks that cannot out a dragoon-like monster) Plus lots of followup. Good points about the Deck: ● Extreme Followup and grind (Ritual Spell in the GY gives you insane plus turn 3+) ● Can search Nibiru or Blockdragon if needed ● Can OTK with any Level 4's (Accesscode line) ● Can get High ATK with Phaleg (for unaffected bossmonsters) ● Toolbox Extradeck ● Ends on Floodgates (Yep fun) but can win without them. Bad Points: ● Dies to skilldrain in most cases. ● Engine alone is over 40, so with HT's and going second cards its 60 cards. Still very consistent but you see non-engine cards less ● Feather duster/LS hurt pretty bad, Portal is an important card. ● Can play around Maxx C only a little bit (Number 41 Turbo - still draw 2 or more.) ● In a best of one you kind of don't know what to make for the endboard. Against drytron you lose if you end on Number 41 for example. ● Appolousa is a scary card for rocks

Siding needs to be changed a little, summon limit and crossout can be changed to some going first cards like solemn judgement or tcboo (I play for the memes). Eagle booster is definitely necessary in this build because it's too fragile (verte/halq/selene etc.)  Another suggestion for a consistent route is removing halq and selene for unicorn and another shizuku/fire charmer and definitely another zeke if you want to remove dpe package.
