This deck is a passion project for a Exosister list that doesn't suck. When Exosister came out in the TCG, the deck was streamlined into being just a Number 39: Utopia Double enabler. Exosister is inherently flawed by the need for multiple generic extenders to get going, The Shaddoll Dogmatika engines work at a very strong way to lock your opponents out of the game, boosting the control power in a way that allows Exosister to crack back. This list is very capable of making a turn 1 Number F0: Utopic Draco Future while also setting up Shaddoll and Dogmatika fusions in the graveyard with Dogmatika Maximus. This in turn allows us to add and set Shaddoll Schism, and to add Dogmatika Fleurdelis, The Knighted to our hand. Pair this with a potentially searched Exosister Vadis from our Exosister Mikailis, and we have 4 interuptions on top of locking out opponent out of special summoning more than once a turn with El Shaddoll Winda. And if our opponent still can play (aka they drew forbidden droplet), we can also potentially go into El Shaddoll Construct on our following turn. Like most turn 1 decks, we focus on not letting our opponent play. Due to our ability to activate Exosister Vadis on our turn, our ability to special summon multiple Dogmatika monsters (including Fleurdelis which permanently buffs all Dogmatika monsters when they attack), our link package, and our ability to lock our opponent from playing the game, our ability to OTK and attack relentlessly into our opponent is very strong. Starters: Unlike alot of decks, there arent single cards that get us going. Exosister Stella and Exosister Elis can special exosisters from hand, or themself from hand respectively, but the deck really relies on what you draw for extenders. With that being said, Exosister Pax could be considered a starter for its ability to pick a perfect Exosister to grab for your starting board, along with being an extender if you have a playable start already. Extenders: For our main extenders, we rely on Nefarious Archfiend Eater of Nefariousness, a non once per turn summons as long as we control a spellcaster. Which means, they can almost always be playable on our board. We also rely on Parallel Exceed as a extender due to its ability to strengthen our access to 2 xyz monsters, as well as an overall consistency boost until we get the new support. Dogmatika Engine: The Dogmatika engine that i chose to run was 2x Nadir Servant, 1x Dogmatika Ecclesia, The Virtuous, 1x Dogmatika Fleurdelis, The Knighted, 1x Dogmatika Maximus,  and 1x Dogmatika Punishment. This package ensures that can get Dogmatika Maximus on the board to send our El Shaddoll Apkallone, and Titaniklad the Ash Dragonto get a search for our Shaddoll Schism, and a summon of Ecclesia for Fleurdelis, or just to add Fleurdelis herself. Dogmatika Ecclesia, the Virtuous also has an ability to act as an extender. Shaddoll Engine: Our Shaddoll engines consists of 1x Shaddoll Schism, 1x El Shaddoll Construct, 1x El Shaddoll Apkallone, and 1x El Shaddoll Winda.

deck_excerpt: High Risk High Reward the deck.
deck_description: The whole idea of this deck is to Go all in or all out using mainly your traps. You want to pay life points, and you don't want your opponent to touch you at all. Your starters for this deck are weird. You have Dinomorphia Theriza, who grabs any Dinomorphia trap from deck, mainly Dinomorphia Domain. However you can also grab Dinomorphia Brute as a great secondary option if you already have domain. Another card that is solid for this is Lord of the Heavenly Prison, with any other trap card he can safely grab your domain from deck. He is also extremely handy for keeping all of your other traps safe, especially the ones you want to keep like Solemn Judgement and Skill Drain. Also it is important to note, that opening Skill Drain is just the best card, since most decks heavily rely on their smaller cards to do alot of movement to get into the bigger cards, Your most easily accessed cards are either 3000, or the main fusion you will be using Dinomorphia Kentregina with a whopping 4000 atk, not many things are gonna climb over her. She also floats which is amazing. Your main Deck Dinomorphia monsters float into each other by banishing a trap which is still amazing, because you can utilize them to keep you alive. A simple strategy is to always banish your "Card effect Protection" traps if you do not have generic random traps in grave to use as cost for them. Your best Named Traps in the deck are Dinomorphia Brute, Dinomorphia Domain, and Dinomorphia Reversion. Reversion is an amazing card as it can copy any Counter trap, i.e. Solemn Judgement and you essentially have to Summon Negates, and that is Super strong against most decks. Domain is a solid fusion from deck that, in this deck, has no real cost, and no restriction. Brute is your solid 1 for 1 removal that lets your dinos float Here is a  basic reaction example for when you have a simple game state and not the "Best" hand. You have a Set Brute, a Dinomorphia Diplos, and a Theriza in GY. Your opponent Normal Summons Prank-Kids Fansies. You can get rid of their first summon by using Brute to pop both diplos and fansies. Use the diplos in GY, banish the Brute, summon the theriza, use her effect, and grab a domain from deck. This does not include the other 3 possible cards you had in a starting hand. Lord of the Heavenly Prison + Solemn Judgement = can grab you any important trap, mostly domain from deck and if you already have domain, easily just grab any random solemn or Dinomorphia Alert for Follow up plays. Alert can help you recover your dead fusions or back both of your level 4's you used for fusions, and then you can XYZ into and Evolz monster and now you either have a negate or if you decide to attack, make Divine Arsenal AA-ZEUS Sky Thunder. Remember in this deck, its High Risk and High Reward. Imagine beating your opponent with 32 Lifepoints left. That's a funny feeling. Have fun paying for others pain. (Edit: I couldn't figure out how to turn of some of the Hyperlinks for the large paragraphs, bugged out or I messed up, dunno.)

deck_excerpt: Typical Eldlich deck with great control and some flexibility with the use of various XYZs.
deck_description: Like many Eldlich decks, focus on maintaining control of the board through traps like Torrential Tribute and Solemn Judgment/Strike and combos with Eldlixir of Scarlet Sanguine and various Golden Land traps until you can build your card advantage. Extras like Skill Drain (most ideal simply because it's a one-time LP cost to shut down effects entirely) and Gozen Match, which is an ace-in-the-hole against decks that rely on many different attributes to be effective, can fill the gaps. Finally, finish up with Eldlich the Golden Lord or any of the XYZ summons, namely Gustav Max and Juggernaut Liebe, which can be a pretty crazy OTK combo given the right circumstances.     I've had a solid experience running a similar deck on Master Duel, and so far it has translated well to TCG play.

deck_excerpt: This deck is built for max synergy. each mill, and each discard should net you an advantage. Mixing the fluffal and lightsworn engines along with the
deck_description:
This deck is built for max synergy. each mill, and each discard should net you an advantage. Mixing the fluffal and lightsworn engines along with the phantom knights make for a powerful combo.   You may notice no hand traps. why? Because a hand trap is not good if discarded or milled and as I stated max synergy. How do you deal with out hand traps? You play normally, discard and some of the milling is a cost and cannot be stopped. If you go against a heavy counter deck you should be able to out resource them. They cannot counter everything. Ash you can bait out, Maxx c you can play though, effect viler and the like (Do not care already discarded what I wanted in grave anyway).  Boss monsters are Number 86: Heroic Champion Rongo bongo(Main combo win con), Arc Rebellion Xyz Dragon(beat down otk), Number F0: Utopic’s(hard to deal with monster and control) and The Phantom Knights of Rusty Bardiche (Control). Very flexible deck.  Beak down on each card   Raiden, Hand of the Lightsworn: Card is warrior level 4 for 86 plays, Mills 2 and is searchable. Will often be the card that get your plays going and will take up your normal summon.  Work well with The Phantom Knights of Shade Brigandine to make a Time Thief Redoer.  Minerva, Lightsworn Maiden: is there as a fourth target for searching and is good to mill and thin the deck. also works when discard for toy or Torn Scales.  Charge of the Light Brigade: Best card to get open hand, mills 3 no matter if negated or Ashed. if you use this it often is GG.  Fluffal Bear: Seaches out Toy for good discard outlet and mill.  Fluffal Wing: Used for the draw power.  Is probably the most dead draw in the deck but can be used with any of the discard effect to get it where it needs to be.  Can also be used to go in to a I:P if needed or special summoned of toy.  Toy Vendor: Is a particularly good card. If milled or discarded it can search out bear or wing as needed. bear can then get you a Toy Vendor. Is a great discard outlet even if you do not draw a fluffal monster odds are whatever you get will be happy in the grave. If you do great free Special summon.  The Phantom Knights of Stained Greaves: Is a level 4 enabler and an easy special summon. In grave adds an effortless way to special summon a phantom knight from the hand.  The Phantom Knights of Ragged Gloves: Good fit card, searched whatever you need in the grave to start combos. Also, can turn and dark xyz into a boss monster with an extra 1000 atk is nice.  The Phantom Knights of Ancient Cloak: Main search card, can get any of your Phantom knights needed and can get The Phantom Knights of Shade Brigandine trap for an easy level 4 summon.  The Phantom Knights of Torn Scales: best combo card in the deck and a good normal summon if you cannot get a Raiden.  Would much rather special summon it from grave for combos but is a card that can help unbrick your hand or win more.  The Phantom Knights of Silent Boots: Good card is Good. Easy extender and can search out your traps for when you need to change up your plays to go back row heavy. Can also get the Phantom Knights of Shade Brigandine for more summons.  Virtual World Hime – Nyannyan: Good card for making Xyz plays. However, make sure to make your links first before summoning him.    Galaxy Cyclone: this is your out to flood gates (most gates can be played around or dealt with by The Phantom Knights of Break Sword) also can be used to pop your own traps/toy vender to trigger their effects.  Divine Arsenal AA-ZEUS - Sky Thunder: you make xyz’s you run this guy  Time Thief Redoer: is good dark xyz that can be made easy with the Phantom Knights of Shade Brigandine or summoned after a The Phantom Knights of Break Sword effect.  Raider's Knight: used after break sword to make break sword number 2 or better yet to go in to Arc Rebellion Xyz Dragon for a otk.  Number 86: Heroic Champion – Rhongomyniad: The reason the deck is hated, the reason we do not care about Maxx C, the reason we win 90% of the time. 

Number 75: Bamboozling Gossip Shadow: Used as a monster negate.  Also used to go into Number 86 to get him at 5. Also used to stop Nibiru, the Primal Being. 

  Leviair the Sea Dragon: Is Leviair, dose Leviair things. Used to go in to easy F0 for F0 things.  Dante, Traveler of the Burning Abyss: sometimes you do not get Raiden and can't start your milling so you make this guy, and he can do it for you. Also, skill drain effect do not stop you from milling 3 as it is a cost. Also good for the F0 plays as you get some extra advantage from the mills.  Number F0: Utopic Future: is there to get to the bigger and better F0. Number F0: Utopic Draco Future. However, can be used to steal boss monsters for a sec. If needed.  Number F0: Utopic Draco Future: Is a hard to kill and deal with Boss monster that steals their monsters. What is not to like.  The Phantom Knights of Rusty Bardiche: The main boss monster of other Phantom knight decks, this deck does not always need to make him. however, he is there and worth it if you can make him.  Also, if you need to change up your style to more control I recommend going in to the rusty here.  I:P Masquerena: Used to make rusty with Raiden or a fluffal if necessary. Also adding the protection to rusty is good.  Cherubini, Ebon Angel of the Burning Abyss: Used to search out what you need in the grave and for going into Rusty.  Can be used with other burning abyss card but I find their negative effect for self-destructing to be not helpful. In a more controlled combo deck then yes, they can work great.

deck_excerpt: A deck whose thesis is to make the Level 5 LIGHT and EARTH Warrior-type "Star" monsters, with some twist.
deck_description: Hi, Grayewick the Fusionist here, and it's been a long time since I've last posted a list. I figured I needed to take a break from everything that is Yu-Gi-Oh considering both the meta game of the TCG and MD, and how absurd the secondary market is right now after doing some market watch, but I digress, I'm here now and I'm back with a fairly budget deck, Star Warriors/Combat Stars/Level 5 Warrior toolbox (??? I honestly don't know what to call this one lol.) As per usual, the side deck will be filled with cards that you might want to consider as either upgrades or substitutes but are not necessarily mandatory for the build. So, why this deck? I've always been interested in making N/R rarity only decks in MD, and this just so happened to fit the bill, with the exception of a few tech choices but, it's whatever. Also, I've always wanted to make this archetype work. The Main Deck, and their respective alternative options, if any: • x3 Tenma the Sky Star, Hayate the Earth Star, & x2 Kaiki the Unity Star - These are your main stars (heh) of the deck. Hayate + Kaiki is pretty much a guaranteed Idaten the Conqueror Star, and those two with Tenma and Polymerization is a guaranteed Shura the Combat Star. Mandatory, no alternatives. • x3 Psi-Reflector, x2 Assault Sentinel, x2 Assault Mode Activate, x1 Assault Beast - Your standard Assault Mode package. Brings out any level 6-9 generic Synchro with the greatest of ease. The only close alternative I can recommend is pivoting into the Arcana Knights by adding x3 King's Knight, x2-3 Arcana Knight Joker, x1-2 Arcana Extra Joker, & x1 Queen's Knight. • x3 Joker's Knight & x1 Jack's Knight - This is just a free Level 5 LIGHT Warrior 2000 ATK body on board each turn (which sometimes becomes relevant with Overlay Booster in which we play 2 of). • x3 Polymerization - Your main win condition is a Fusion Monster so, you know... • x3 Feast of the Wild LV5 - Your main win condition requires Level 5 or higher Warrior monsters so, you know... It's just a worse Soul Charge, but a Soul Charge nonetheless. • x3 Lightning Storm - Could be anything, really. Pot of Prosperity/Pot of Extravagance/Pot of Avarice as consistency/recovery pieces, Fusion Deployment or Unexpected Dai for the Arcana Knights, etc. The Extra Deck: • x2 Idaten the Conqueror Star & x2 Shura the Combat Star - Your main win conditions. Idaten the Conqueror Star makes it easy for you to climb into Shura, so you don't really need 3 of him. This is also strange because Shura the Combat Star is "supposed to be" an upgrade from Idaten but somehow he feels weaker in testing? So, if you wanna make room for a Stardust Dragon if you also wanna play Stardust Dragon/Assault Mode, one less copy of Shura the Combat Star won't hurt. • Psy-Framelord Omega - Understandable. Flex spot, but I'd argue mandatory due to Dogmatika's existence. • Scarlight Red Dragon Archfiend - Just a good generic Level 8 Synchro. Also a flex spot. • Colossal Fighter - Neat thematic boss monster, keeps on coming back when destroyed by battle. Mandatory if you want to play Colossal Fighter/Assault Mode, which we don't really have an excuse not to since our deck is focused on Warrior-type monsters anyway. • Divine Arsenal AA-Zeus - Sky Thunder - We play some Xyz monsters. Could also be a flex spot, definitely not mandatory. • Tiras, Keeper of Genesis & Adreus, Keeper of Armageddon - Generic Rank 5 Xyz monsters. The only alternative for either or both of them is Constellar Pleiades and Shark Fortress. • I:P Masquerena & Mekk-Knight Crusadia Avramax - These two should always go together. Not mandatory, but if you have them, there's no reason not to use both. Gets over a lot of Towers monsters like Blue-Eyes Chaos MAX Dragon, and is a non-targeting, non-destruction removal upon getting rid of. • Gaia Saber, the Lightning Shadow, LANphorhynchus, & Knightmare Unicorn - The latter's just removal coverage, LANphorhynchus is just a ladder to Avramax, and the former is just a generic Link 3 and a flex spot. Testing and Closing Thoughts It's... okay. It's not competitive by any means but, it does what it wants to do, at least. If rogue tier is consisted of decks whose viability to be pushed past rogue depends on its pilot, this is a deck whose viability to be pushed into rogue status depends on its pilot. It's not the fastest deck there is, but if you just want a cheap beat down deck for Master Duel then hey, you know. Just slap a bunch of generic staples that you currently have access to in this deck and you'll probably be just fine, I think. Overall, all I really wanted is to make this deck work, and I think I can be satisfied with this. Surely this could still be improved upon, but it's not that I'm gonna stop testing. Also, who doesn't like taking breaks from playing meta time to time? If you have any questions or thoughts, feel free to express them down in the comments and I'll respond to them as soon as I possibly can.

deck_excerpt: "So anyways, I started blasting." -Frank Reynolds, "It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia"
deck_description: After a month of playing around with different decks, I have stuck with Magical Musketeers, and I will be writing this guide about how to play them! Magical Musketeers are an off-meta deck, being able to disrupt almost anything your opponent throws at you given the right hand and draws. The Magical Musketeers all have 2 shared effects: 1. You can activate "Magical Musket" Spell/Traps directly from your hand on your opponent's turn. Being able to wretch out a counter trap or monster negate from your hand is PRETTY GOOD if you ask me. And number 2. All the Main Deck monsters have effects when a spell/trap is activated in their columns, which means they kinda play like Mekk-Knights, which is pretty cool.  We know how I do this. I explain the monsters, then the Spell/Traps, then the Extra deck monsters.  Anyways, the monsters. We're running the popular combination of handtraps: Ash Blossom and Maxx "C". I really shouldn't have to explain these cards, they explain themselves in their text and gameplay. Super powerful and can single-handedly turn a bad opener into a devastating hand. And then there's Dragon Buster Destruction Sword. You will only use this is a stupid combo with Cherubini and Union Carrier.  Now, the Magical Musketeers. We have 3 Capsar, 3 Doc, 3 Starfire, 2 Kidbrave, and 1 Calamity. Caspar is possibly the strongest main deck Musketeer. When a spell/trap is activated in this lad's column, you get to search a "Magical Musket" card from your deck given its a name that wasn't activated in the chain and resolve. He can search either a monster, spell, or trap, so his utility is amazing. Doc adds a Magical Musket card from your GY to your hand when a spell/trap is used in his column. He's the Caspar of the GY, which has its uses, being able to recycle powerful spell/traps or the link monster I'll explain later. Starfire special summons a Magical Musketeer from the deck given its Level 4 or lower. Which is fair, because being able to special Mastermind, a Level 8 with a powerful end of turn effect to draw cards equal to the number of Magical Musket spell/traps you activated that turn. Kidbrave allows you to discard 1 card to draw 2 cards. Baby Graceful Charity is still decent, but not as good as selecting cards you want to add to your hand, so that's why we run him at 2. Calamity reborns a Magical Musketeer from your GY when a spell/trap is activated in her column. It has utility, but not enough to run at 3 or even 2. Plus, we can search her with Caspar anyways, so 1 copy is fine.  Now, the Spell/Traps. Most of these cards are the generic power cards, so I'll go over them first. 1 Raigeki, 3 Pot of Desires, 3 Cosmic Cyclone, 2 Called by the Grave, and 2 Forbidden Droplet. I'm not gonna go into extreme detail about them, I'll just briefly explain what they do and why I ran them over certain cards. Raigeki pops all your opponent's monsters. Pot of Desires banishes 10 cards from your deck for you to draw 2 cards. "Why not run Extravagance or Prosperity?" Because we enjoy our Extra Deck. Like, A LOT. We have extremely powerful cards in it that I don't want to get rid of, so I use Desires instead. Cosmic Cyclone allows you to pay 1000 LP for a Spell Speed 2 Spell/Trap banish. You can run Twin Twisters in this spot, but I'd rather not discard potentially game-winning starters and spell/traps to pop 2. Plus, Eldlich is a pain, so banishing cards is great! Called by the Grave is your way of saying "I don't like being hand-trapped today, thank you though." You usually never wanna get Ash'd with this deck, so running this card is a must. Forbidden Droplet allows you to send cards in your possession (field AND hand) to be able to negate the effects and halve the ATK of monsters equal to the amount of cards you sent. It also has the added bonus of your opponent not responding with cards if you sent cards of that type to the GY for the cost of the card. Which means theoretically, this is a Spell Speed 3 spell, which Spell Speed 3 is only for Counter Traps. You can honestly run Forbidden Chalice or Infinite Impermanance instead of this. Any of them are fine.  And the last of the main deck: our Magical Musket Spell/Traps. 3 Cross-Domination, 3 Desperado, 3 Last Stand, 1 Dancing Needle, and 1 Crooked Crown. Cross Domination is the archetype's "Forbidden"-type quick-play spell, being able to negate any monster's effect and set their ATK value to 0. Desperado pops any face-up card on the field. Dancing Needle banishes up to 3 cards in any GY and banishes them. Its good for proactively banishing problematic cards in your opponent's GY. Crooked Crown allows you to special summon a Magical Musketeer from your hand and if you do, your opponent can't summon a monster in their monster zone in the column that your Musketeer was summoned in.  Now its time for the Extra Deck. Not gonna lie, space was a little tough trying to balance out the extra deck. At first, I wanted to run a Utopia OTK package with Utopia, Utopia Double, and Double or Nothing, but it didn't come up a lot, so I chose the Buster Lock, with Cherubini, Union Carrier, and Dragon Buster Destruction Sword. If you wanna go all in for this, I recommend running Cir and Graff, both Burning Abyss monsters. I did it without them because I think we have plenty of Level 3's Anyways, we got 3 Magical Musketeer Max, 2 Phantom Knights of Break Sword, 1 Abyss Dweller, 1 Tornado Dragon, 1 Bagooska, 1 Cherubini, 1 Knightmare Phoenix, 1 Union Carrier, 1 Masquerena, 1 Knightmare Unicorn, 1 Crusadia Avramax, and 1 Accesscode Talker.  Magical Musketeer Max is the strongest card in this deck. Going 2nd and summoning this card is a potential +5 in card advantage, which is INSANE for a Link 1 monster. When he's Link summoned, you can special summon Magical Musketeers from your deck equal to the amount of spell/traps your opponent control or he can grab Magical Musket spell/traps equal to the amount of monsters they have on their field, given the spell/traps have different names. Break Sword is a Generic Rank 3 Xyz monster that can pop one card you control and they control. I'll be honest, most Rank 3 Xyz monsters in the game are awful, so I think Break Sword is the one worth running. Abyss Dweller shuts down your opponent's GY effects for an entire turn as a Spell Speed 2 effect. Crazy. Tornado Dragon is a Spell Speed 2 Spell/Trap pop. Bagooska is the best stall card when it comes to Rank 4's, so we run him as a last resort when we need a turn or 2 to hopefully turn the tide. Cherubini and Union Carrier solely exist to perform the Buster Lock with Destruction Sword. If you want this to be consistent, run Cir and Graff in the main deck like how PK Rhongo Turbo uses them to get into Cherubini and other important Rank 3's. Knightmare Phoenix and Unicorn are Spell/Trap pops and card bounces respectively, as long as you discard a card for cost. They are generically good link-climbing monsters. Crusadia Avramax is a Link 4 Boss Monster you can build up to, and it doesn't let your opponent target it with card effects and their monsters can only target him for attacks. Oh yeah, and when a special summoned monster attacks him, he can gain ATK equal to that monster's ATK during damage calc. Note that this is once per BATTLE, not once per TURN. And he floats into a shuffle when he's sent to the GY because of the opponent. And finally, Accesscode Talker. I have nothing to say about him. You should know he WILL end your game if summoned.  I'll go over possible inclusions for this deck that I didn't have: Utopia OTK package (Utopia, Utopia Double, and Double or Nothing), Graff and Cir (to help the Buster Lock), and every possible going second tool. This deck LOVES to go 2nd, so including cards like Lightning Storm, Harpie's Feather Duster, Evenly Matched, Dark Ruler No More, etc. are EXTREMELY good choices if you wanna go for it.  Anyways, that's it for these weirdos with guns. Have fun playing a mildly infuriating to go against deck and hopefully this guide helped you!

deck_excerpt: This is a new Eldlich list that I've been experimenting with. It uses a small Cyberse engine so that you an gain extra card advantage and take advanta
deck_description: The main combo can be accessed by using either Cyberse Gadget or Dotscpaer. Keep in mind that both of these cards can be searched by using Cynet Mining, which is played at 3 copies in the deck. You're first going to normal summon either your Cyberse Gadget or your Dotscaper. You're then going to link the card you summoned off for a copy of Link Disciple. Then, you can trigger the effect from the GY to get yourself back a monster (Cyberse Gadget gives you a token and Dotscaper Special Summons itself back to the field). Then, you're going to link away the Token//Dotscaper for a copy of Link Devote. Then, you're going to use Link Disciple's effect to tribute the Link Devotee to draw 1 card, then stack a card from your hand to the bottom of your deck. Then the effect of Link Devotee triggers since it was tributed, which gives you 2 tokens. Finally, you're going to link away the 2 tokens for a copy of I:P Masquerena. Along with this combo, you also run an Eldlich engine. With your Eldlich engine, you can also set lots of traps to interrupt your opponent's plays. Both of these engines allow for a great going first board and an equally great follow up. You also run the DPE package along with the Artifact Dagda + Sctythe, which stops your opponent from special summoning from the Extra Deck.

deck_excerpt: Built w/ many negates and strong, versatile combos
deck_description: The main power of this deck comes from its flexibility.  There are many avenues you can take that end in different end-boards depending on what it is you're trying to accomplish.  There is a lot of variance in the starting hands, but what I have found is that 8/10 times the hand is not only playable, but gets you into one of the core combo's of the deck.  Scenario 1: Going first setting up a Scythe lock (typically the ideal scenario when going first)  The goal here is to get Scythe into the grave by the time your opponent's MP1 starts.  Example starting hand w/ out Adventurer: VW Lulu, VW Lili, VW Qinglong, Forbidden Droplet, E-Tele.  I like to start w/ a bait here, so I will typically open with the E-Tele to try and draw out an Ash to clear my way to go full combo.  However, the best play is to activate the Qinglong, then go for the Lulu Special Summon (SS) targeting Qinglong.  If that goes through, we continue.  If that gets negated, we are OK because we can still Normal Summon (NS) the Lulu further down the line.  Follow up w/ the SS of Lili, dumping a Nyannyan and a Chuche.  Now we are going to NS the Lulu, activating the effect of Nyan from grave to SS as a lv3 tuner.  If there is a serious concern about Nibiru here, you can hold off on the Nyan summon as we will not get the omni-negate in this scenario until our 6th summon.  If not, then proceed w/ the Nyan SS.  Activate the Chuche, bump up the Lulu to lv6, XYZ into Beatrice.  Activate Beatrice, dump Water Enchantress.  Activate Enchantress, get the Rite, go full Adventurer combo to get token & Gryphon + Dracoback.  Now we have Beatrice (w/1 material), Token, Gryphon, Fateful, Dracoback on field, E-Tele and Droplet.  Activate E-Tele to go get Lulu, then if you have not already activated Nyan we can now activate from GY to SS.  Synchro Gryphon and Lulu into Baronne, pass turn.  On opponent's Standby, first activate Beatrice to detach the material and dump Artifact Scythe.  As a follow-up, in a separate Chain, activate Baronne to SS the Scythe sent to the GY.  If there is a negate activated, use Baronne's ability to omni-negate.  Boom - no ED activity from your opponent on that turn.
SPICY CONTROL OTK ( Budget V.)

deck_excerpt: Fun, decently competitive (I made it to Plat 5) Blue-Eyes deck for Master Duel. YOU WILL BRICK, but when you get a good hand you can OTK or outlast yo
deck_description: Goal is to get out as many Lv. 8 monsters to Xyz into Draglubion --> then get out Hope Harbinger for spell negate or Numeron Dragon for damage. Lots of revive cards so getting Blue-Eyes in GY helps. Spirit dragon negates GY effects, and you can use its effect to get Azure-Eyes out to protect your dragons. Duplicates of Xyzs mainly used as ammo for Draglubion's effect. Heart-eartH and Zeus used defensively. Not sure when new Blue-Eyes support will be added to Master Duel but will definitely make it into the deck. Add more hand traps if you can afford it.  Spirit of White can pop an opponent's Skill Drain if you chain its second effect to tribute it for a Blue-Eyes in your hand (skill drain only affects cards on the field).  Brick-Eyes is a problem, add draw cards if you have them. You can also use Cards of Consonance, Trade-In, and Burst Stream as bait set cards if you can't use them at the time (you'd be surprised how many people will waste back-row clear on them). Ash Blossom kinda ruins your plays, so add Called by the Grave if you can afford it.  True Light 's risks can be somewhat negated with either Azure-Eyes or Ultimate Creature of Destruction.  Future fusion used primarily to dump 5 cards to graveyard (white stone and blue eyes using 5-headed dragon as target) for effects and combo with RotDL.

deck_name: Master Duel Junk Synchron/Crystal Wing Synchro Dragon
deck_excerpt: Junk Synchron/Crystal Wing Synchro Dragon deck for Master Duel. Decently competitive in Gold, might need additional UR's and handtraps for Plat (I don
deck_description: Main combo is Junk Speeder --> Stardust Charge (search Junk Servant with Jet Synchron) --> Crystal Wing plus whatever you can make with the leftovers (usually Lv. 7 or 9).  First turn you can use Junk Connector to get a Lv. 2 in the GY then bring him back with Junk Synchron to get Junk Speeder. You can also use Synchron Carrier to get an extra normal summon for Junk Synchron. If you already have JS you can use Tuning to get Satellite Synchron for the Special Summon when you use JS's effect.  Revive spells and traps work well with Doppel Warrior and Satellite Synchron's effects.  If you can get out Clear Wing, Stardust Dragon, and Black Rose out at the same time you're pretty well set.  Synchronized Real can either be really good or absolute trash depending on when you draw it --> might be worth switching out for handtraps.  Traps are mainly just what I had available, feel free to swap out for better UR's like Imperm. Paleozoic can be used to dump a Lv. 2 to the GY and its second effect can be comboed with Doppel Warrior or Satellite Synchron.
Fusion and link primarily to overpower and control opponent. Has N107 for consistency.

Updated version of my other Madolche deck after a few dozen hours of testing and a hundred or so duels. Ratio of Madolche cards in the deck is pretty much perfect, though if you need room you can remove 1 Magileine and maybe run Madolche nights if you feel you need another target for Salon. Side deck includes a number of cards that i have tested and consider good valid options depending on the meta. Madolche Promenade is to me the most important card of this deck and by far the best and most underrated Madolche card, it gives you a searchable negate and made all other madolche traps either obsolete or just mostly redundant in the case of nights. It gives you a GY play to add Brickingcess as a material to your boss monsters and it's the most consistent disruption you have. It's a shame it's once per turn.  You really don't want to be running more than 1 ticket. 2 Chateau does give you some other plays but it loses you consistency. 3 Salon is redundant. The boss madolches are all fine at 2, no reason to run 3 of any of them as you can recycle them easily if needed. Brickingcess's crucial as XYZ mat for Chocolat as well as the best target for Petingcessoeur to combo into Tiaramisu or Glassouflé that said you don't want to draw into her at all, hence the nickname and why you only want 1 copy of her.  Barrier statue is an excellent floodgate that stops your opponent but not you, though it costs a normal summon, Rescue cat is something i'm testing and it gives you a 1 card combo to summon two hootcakes to overlay into Leviair and maybe bring back a banished Anjelly as well in the process, though beware it won't work if you have used Petingcessoeur's effect in the same turn, but you can still use her effect afterwards.  Currently waiting for some new cards to be added, namely Small World and Vernalizer Fairies so i can improve madolche's turn 1 board, as it is the best you can do is usually Sistart + Glassouflé with a face up Salon and a set Promenade. It's very consistent and not bad, but not enough to deal with meta and not even remotely close to the oppressive boards most modern decks can do turn 1.

deck_name: Non-budget Altergeist deck for same friend
deck_description: Imperm > Multifaker > Have fun

This time, while i was testing many Sunavalon builds i asked myself the most relevant question of this meta "Can i put Brave Token in this?", and not only i found a way of using brave token but also included Therion to make the 1 card combo even stronger. The end board is usually: Therion "King" Regulus, Benghalancer and Drytrentiay + Possible Brave Token spicy.
  • For the one card combo you only need Sunseed Genius Loci... One card combo:
Summon Genius Loci (Using Unexpected Dai, One For One or normal summoning it) ~Link summon Sunavalon Dryas ~Activate Dryas effect and add Sunvine Sowing ~Activate Sowing to special summon Sunavalon Twins from your deck and pay 1000 LP ~Chain link 1 Dryas and link 2 Twins ~Twin summon Genius Loci back, then Dryas gives you 1000 LP and special summon Sunvine Healer (Be careful when chosing the zones, you might not be able to summon healer nor use the next link monster effects) ~Activate Healer effect to gain 300 LP ~Link summon Aromaseraphy Jasmine using Dryas and any plant monster except Healer ~Activate Jasmine effect to tribute a monster its pointing to and special summon Mardel, Generaider Boss of Light from your deck ~Mardel trigger and adds Aromage Laurel from deck ~Special summon Laurel ~Link summon Sunavalon Melias using Mardel, Laurel and Healer ~ Chain link 1 Melias and link 2 Laurel ~Melias special summon back Genius Luci from GY and Laurel gives you more 500 LP ~Chain Jasmine second effect and add Therion "Lily" Borea from deck ~ link Summon another Melias using Jasmine and Genius Luci ~Summon Genius Luci from GY again ~Activate "Lily" Borea at your hand ~"Lily" Borea special summons itself and equip a plant monster from your GY to it ~Activate "Lily" Borea second effect to send the equipped card to the GY and add Therion's Ring, The Colosseum Saucer ~Link summon Benghalancer using 1 Melias and "Lily" ~Link summon Healer using Genius Loci (You can also summon Dryas if you want follow up) ~Healer effect +900 LP ~Link summon Drytrentiay ~Drytrentiay adds Sunavalon Bloom ~Activate Therion's Ring and add "King" Regulus from deck ~Activate "King" Regulus effect to special summon itself and equip "Lily" Borea to it. Thats all. Wandering Griphon Rider really helps to let this combo go through, you just need to be extra careful about your zones.     Being honest now, i wasn't a herb addicted until i started using Sunavalon.     GLHF

deck_excerpt: Fun version of Earth Machine taking advantage of Machina's great supports.
deck_description: Infinitrack Machina, Earth Machine or Earth Toolbox is a fantastic deck that takes full advantage of engines and archetypes geared towards Earth monsters from the Machine attribute. By integrating several different engines this deck has been going through changes over time with the arrival of new supports. The most recent were new Machina cards which is the main focus of this decklist. But in the future they saw more cards to improve the deck's roof even more like Therions' archetype that basically brings an omni negate Therions' "King" Regulus to all decks that put Machine monsters in the GY. Also the Therions' allow you to loop Omni Negate back to the field thanks to the archetype's field spell Therions' Ring, the Colosseum Saucer so it will definitely make a big impact on the TCG as it already does on the OCG in decks like ABC and Sky Striker for example. The week I'm posting this decklist was also announced a Fairy-type archetype that interacts with Earth monsters in a very interesting way called Vernalizer and that is definitely another addition to Infinitrack Machina. It's because this deck is constantly changing that I see it with gigantic potential to be one of the best decks in the format in the future, I have no doubt if it gets to big tournaments. Speaking specifically of the decklist below, the main additions are: Machina Unclaspare and Machina Ruinforce. The interesting thing about Machina Unclaspare is that it allows you to make moves with only Machina Redeployment that previously could only be done with a 3-card combo, such as making RANK-9 Phantom Fortress, RANK-10 Super Dora at the same time as having Machina Citadel Outstanding to make your opponent think twice before trying to destroy your monsters. The fact that you make this move of sending a Machina Monster to the GY and then doing RANK-4 Gear Gigant X is also a great interaction bait if you have plays behind and the opponent spends hand traps on these cards. Overall Machina Ruinforce is being used more because it's a forfun version of the deck because I don't think it helps the deck in the grind game in the same way as cards like Infinitrack Anchor Drill that I'm not using in this version because I prioritize accessing the new boss monster from Machina archetype. If I were using a more competitive version Machina Ruinforce would be Anchor Drill and that way I would go back to using RANK-8 Dingirsu, in the Extra Deck instead of the second Super Nova. I've been told that this deck is very good if used with more than 40 cards but I particularly like to use as few cards as possible in my decks to fit a lot of tech cards even more in this format that if you don't use at least 12 tech cards you will suffer a lot against Adventurer Token, Destroyer Phoenix Enforcer and Good Stuff engines like Rose Dragon engines to make very strong combos with Halqifibrax and Auroradon accessing several Synchro Monsters Omni Negate type Borreload Savage and Herald of the Arc Light and especially the best Synchro Monster in the game: Baronne de Fleur. Not to mention that these moves can access cards like Fairy Tail Snow or passing with Artifact Scythe Lock. That's why I only use 1 Infinitrack Trencher and two Urgent Schedule. //////////////////////////////////////////////// /////////////////Main combos: Combo 1: ***Harvester/Heavy Forward example (Basically the basic 1 combo card but in the end you make RANK-10) ////////////////////////////////////////////////The next Combos are the ones that the deck already made of Machina Redeployment before the new supports and that are interesting to know even though now you can do them only with Redeployment+Discard having the same result - The main problem with some of the following combos is that you don't have access to the Bullet Train of turn 1 which makes the Grind Game a lot worse: /////////////////////////////////////////////// Combo 5: Harvester + (Redeployment + Discard) (RANK-10 + Citadel Access SAFE ROTA) NS Harvester and eff Add Dozer LINK-1 Goliath Dozer eff tribute Goliath summon and eff Special Trencher from Deck (LOCK YOU INTO EARTH MACHINE) RANK-5 Stormer and eff Detach Trencher Add Derricrane (What to add to the hand (Derricrane/Bullet Train) depends on the match up because if you already have enough hand traps to stop your opponent's turn you don't need Derricrane's pop and can opt for the Bullet Train instead. have multiple engine cards in hand then Derricrane's pop will be very valuable) LINK-1 Goliath Activate Redeployment Discard Random Card Add Fortress and Citadel (If you have a good discard you don't need to use Trencher eff no gy to have better follow ups on the way back because this combo doesn't depend on Trencher to work) Discard Citadel Summon Fortress LINK-2 Ballista and eff Add Box and eff Add Tunneller Discard Box and Tunneller Summon Fortress LINK-2 Knuckle ***Tunneller eff cl1 to Pot of AVARICE (2 GOLIATH, Ballista, Box and Citadel) ***Knuckle eff cl2 send ITSELF Special Citadel Special Derricrane in the Resolution RANK-10 Super Dora Trencher eff Reborn Harvester LINK-1 Goliath (using Harvester) River Stormer eff tribute Goliath summon itself **GOLIATH eff Attach to Super Dora End Phase: Super Dora eff target itself Detach Citadel Gamestate: Super Dora(protection Destruction + Derricrane) + Stormer(Follow Up) /in Hand: 2 DRAWS /in GY: Fortress + Citadel (This Combo is safe ROTA because you don't need luck to have access to RANK-10 play as it adds with River Stormer and not randomly with Metalcruncher effect) The rest is Redeployment Add Fortress and Citadel which is the same result of the new Redeployment combo) /////////////////////////////////////////////// Combo 6: Redeployment + Discard (OTK Version) Activate Redeployment and Discard 1 Add Metalcruncher and Fortress NS Metalcruncher and eff REVEAL 3 Harvest and Add Harvester (This same combo start goes for the new combo with Machina Gearframe and Machina Unclaspare since the goal will always be to have Harvester and Fortress in hand to start standard Machina Redeployment combo moves) Discard Fortress and Harvester to GY to Special Fortress LINK-2 Ballista and eff Add Box and eff Add Trencher Discard Box and Trencher to summon Frotress from GY Trencher eff Reborn Hasvester Harvester eff Add Dozer Harvester eff target Fortress and make both lv9 ***RANK-9 Earth Slicer and eff Detach 2 to pop 2 Cards from Opponent Tribute Ballista summon Dozer and eff Summon Tunneller from Deck (LOCK YOU INTO EARTH MACHINE) ***RANK-5 Stormer and eff Add Citadel Discard Citadel summon Fortress ***Battle Phase: Attack for 8100damage Or Crash either (Machina Fortress) or River Stormer cl1 Fortress pop another Card (MANDATORY EFFECT) cl2 Citadel Reborn Gamestate: Earth Slicer + Citadel + Stormer = 8600damage (Here the combo is basic Redeployment+Discard but you do RANK-9 Earth Slicer instead of Phantom Fortress and add Machina Citadel with RANK-5 Stormer and have the trick of being able to destroy your own cards with Earth Slicer eff to trigger Machina Citadel eff in GY if necessary or even crash your monsters in battle like Machina Fortress and destroy an opponent's card at the same time Machina Citadel enters the field) //////////////////////////////////////////////// ***Combo 7: Redeployment + Metalcruncher/Harvester (SAFE ROTA Citadel Access) NS Metalcruncher and eff REVEAL 3 Dozer and Add Dozer Dozer eff tribute Metalcruncher special Dozer eff Special Trencher (LOCK YOU INTO EARTH MACHINE) ***RANK-5 Stormer and eff Add Machina Fortress ***Redeployment eff Discard Fortress Add Machina Citadel and Machina Overdrive Discard Citadel Summon Fortress LINK-1 Goliath Stormer eff tribute Goliath LINK-1 Goliath LINK-2 Ballista and eff Add Box and eff Add Tunneller Discard Tunneller and Box summon Fortress LINK-2 Knuckle Tunneller eff to Pot of AVARICE (2 GOLIATH, Ballista, Box and Metalcruncher) Gamestate: Knuckle + Overdrive /in Hand: 2 DRAWS /in GY: Stormer + Citadel + Fortress + (Dozer + Trencher) Opponent's Turn: Machina Overdrive eff summon Metalcruncher and destroy Knuckle Metalcruncher cl1 Citadel cl2 ***REVEAL Harvester/Anchor Drill/Box If you add Harvester: can send Harvester for Knuckle Trencher eff Reborn Harvester and add Dozer If you can revive Fortress you can go to a RANK-9 without using your Normal/Set If Ancient Gear Box is Added: eff add Anchor Drill can send Anchor Drill for Knuckle Trencher eff Reborn Anchor Drill and eff Special Box and you can go to a RANK-8 DINGIRSU without using your Normal/Set (This is the Combo of the SAFE version where you first do RANK-5 River Stormer Add Machina Fortress and then you activate Machina Redeployment and add Citadel and Overdrive The problem with this combo is that you don't access the Bullet Train on turn 1 but even so the Follow Ups are insane so I consider this the best combo to do in the Earth Machine deck so far) /////////////////////////////////////////////// Combo 8: Redeployment + Discard + Dozer (vs Droll & Lock Bird) Redeployment Add Gearframe and Unclaspare and eff SS from Hand cl1 and Opponent's use Droll & Lock Bird as cl2 Unclaspare eff send Machina Citadel and NS Gearframe Dozer tribute Gearframe and SS Trencher from DECK and RANK-5 Stormer and eff Send Bullet Train LINK-1 Goliath and LINK-2 Knuckle End Phase Bullet Train eff Add Dozer to Hand Gamestate: LINK-2 Knuckle /in Hand: Dozer /in GY: Citadel + Trencher + Stormer + Bullet Train /////////////////////////////////////////////// Combo 8.1: Metalcruncher/Harvester (vs Droll & Lock Bird) NS Starter and eff Add Brutal Dozer and in the resolution Opponent's activates Droll & Lock Bird Dozer eff tribute to Special from Hand and eff Special Trencher = RANK-5 Stormer = Send Bullet Train and LINK-1 Goliath Trencher eff Reborn Dozer and LINK-2 Knuckle and Bullet Train Add Dozer in End Phase Gamestate: Knuckle /in Hand: Dozer /in GY: Stormer + Bullet Train + Metalcruncher /////////////////////////////////////////////// Combo 9: Urgent Schedule (Blind Second Earth Slicer + Citadel ROTA) Activate Urgent Schedule ***Special Fortress and Harvester LINK-2 Ballista and eff Add Box and eff Add Trencher discard Box and Trencher summon Fortress Trencher eff Reborn Harvester Harvester eff Add Dozer RANK-9 Earth Slicer Dozer eff tribute Ballista and eff Special Tunneller from Deck (LOCK YOU INTO EARTH MACHINE) ***RANK-5 Stormer and eff SEND Machina Citadel to GY LINK-1 Goliath ***RANK-9 Earth Slicer eff detach 2 to pop 2 cards INCLUDING GOLIATH Citadel eff cl1 Goliath eff cl2 Tunneller eff to Pot of AVARICE (Ballista, Box, Harvester, Dozer and Stormer) Gamestate: RANK-9 Slicer + Citadel /in Hand: 2 DRAWS /in GY: Fortress Combo 9.1: Urgent Schedule (Phantom Fortress ROTA) (Here you add Bullet Train with River Stormer because you are not going to try to break opponent's entire field but to do the standard play of the deck and grind game with the opponent) /////////////////////////////////////////////// Combo 10: Urgent Schedule Turn 1 play (Let's assume you did the 1 Card Combo Harvester turn 1 which doesn't need to use the River Stormer effect to get back from the GY to get 3 Goliath in the GY, so with the Tunneller eff you gave Urgent Schedule draw. In this case you have a trick you can do to gain access to a Level 10 Machine monster like Derricrane for example. This combo can also be done with the Metalcruncher 1 Card Combo if you choose not to use the River Stormer effect of coming back from the GY if you already have the Urgent Schedule in hand because you want to make this move to access Level 10 Machine and even be able to do the RANK-10 Super Dora) River Stormer eff tribute Knuckle ***Set Urgent Schedule and use Knuckle GY eff send Schedule to Reborn itself ***Urgent Schedule eff Add LV10 Machine Monster to Hand like Derricrane) //////////////////////////////////////////////////Most common turn 3 play attempts: ***(Anchor Drill + Ancient Gear Box in Hand) and (Trencher + River Stormer in GY) and (Knuckle in GY + Brutal Dozer in Hand) and (Normal Summon Harvester + Machina Fortress Special Summon from GY) Knuckle eff send 1 Card to GY and Reborn itself and Brutal Dozer tribute it and eff Special from Deck (always save Dozer effect last if you want to Summon non-Earth Attribute Machine monsters onto the field). NS Harvester and eff Add Dozer and SS Fortress by discarding Ruinforce/any combination of levels equal 8 or higher = RANK-9 Earth Slicer = eff destroy 2 cards. Trencher eff Reborn any Infinitrack Monster and LINK-1 Goliath and River Stormer eff in GY = free Search Derricrane and LINK-1 Goliath to trigger Derricrane eff and Special from Hand and can make RANK-10 Gustav Max per example. ***If you are using the Anchor Drill you have the play layer of Normal Summoning it and bringing Ancient Gear Box to the field and adding the level of the two to RANK-8 Dingirsu,. ///////////////////////////////////////////////Technoplay: Interactions involving Knuckle: Knuckle + Machina Overdrive = "Machina Overdrive" SS effect from deck will RESOLVE WITHOUT EFFECT if the TARGET LEAVE the FIELD BEFORE RESOLUTION, because Overdrive check names at resolution. So cl1 Overdrive cl2 Knuckle SEND ITSELF don't works. But cl1 Overdrive cl2 Knuckle SEND Ancient Gear Box for Example works. Knuckle + Nibiru,: cl1 Knuckle send itself cl2 Nibiru = SS Nibiru and SS Bullet Train from GY Knuckle + Torrential Tribute: Torrential Tribute cl1 and Knuckle cl2 send itself and Reborn Bullet Train to make sure you have a GY monster back into your hand in the End Phase. Knuckle + Urgent Schedule vs Opponent have 1 monster on board = Knuckle eff send itself to GY as cost and cl2 Urgent Schedule ***SS Harvester and SS Citadel and Reborn Bullet Train If Level 10 survives if the opponent doesn't want you to add a monster to the hand with the Bullet Train or the Citadel can come back from the GY you start the turn with Super Dora Knuckle manages to play well around Skill Drain as he can send pro gy as a cost of the effect itself. Super Dora + Machina Overdrive = cl1 Overdrive cl2 Super Dora tgt itself works because you don't need to destroy the target in order to summon. Combo: Urgent Schedule + Machina Overdrive ***Urgent Schedule = SS Harvester and Trencher from DECK Overdrive eff target Trencher and SS Machina Citadel from DECK and eff Raigeki Opponent's Field Next Turn: LINK-2 Ballista and eff Add Box and Anchor Drill per example. Trencher eff in GY Reborn Harvester = Add Dozer and tribute Ballista to SS from Hand and eff SS Tunneller from DECK and RANK-5 River Stormer. Machina Overdrive and Qliphort Genius Interaction = SS Machina from DECK and the Qliphot is not destroyed. Ice Dragon's Prison/D.D. Crow/Called By the GY vs Knuckle/Machina Overdrive = You can use Anger Knuckle Quick eff in Main Phase or Machina Overdrive GY eff to take out the target the opponent is trying to banish or special summon to their field or even trying to return the card to the deck which is something that happens a lot when you have the Machina Citadel in the GY for example generating huge pressure on the opponent if he tries to destroy your monsters. "Droll & Lock Bird" vs Machina Overdrive = can play around Droll&Lock Bird using Overdrive GY effect during the DRAW Phase. "Machina CITADEL" effect to Destroy will Resolve without effect if the target leave the field before resolution, because Citadel checks ATK stats at resolution. But you don't need to destroy your monster to resolve the effect so if your monster isn't destroyed because it's under the protection of LINK-1 Goliath or Super Dora for example, your opponent's will still be destroyed. "Machina FORTRESS" 2nd effect its MANDATORY so it Will ALWAYS be Chain Link 1, in the case of crash in battle phase Machina Citadel eff in GY will be cl2. Thanks to Machina Fortress and Machina Citadel the deck can play against floodgates like Skill Drain and There Can Be Only One because the Fortress when destroyed by battle you destroy a card that the opponent controls and the Citadel returns to the field every turn as a 3k ATK body and possible Raigeki Opponent's Field effect. Now if you yourself are using Skill Drain and want to take it out of the field you can simply use LINK-2 Knuckle eff send Skill Drain to GY as Cost to Reborn itself to Field and start activating Monster effects. A very simple OTK to do with this deck is you use Ancient Gear Ballista eff destroy your spell/trap to make opponent monster ATK/DEF=0 and having access to RANK-10 Gustav Max you do 2k damage and then do RANK-11 Juggernaut Liebe and use effect to gain 2k atk and thus attack the monster with 0ATK and inflict 6k damage granting OTK. The XYZ monster that has the LINK-1 Goliath as material is only protected from destruction by card effects while the Goliath is attached as material so if you detach it to activate the XYZ Monster's effect it will lose protection. For some reason Machina Ruinforce is a DARK monster so be wary of that detail because you can't Summon it to the field if it's under the restriction of Infinitrack Brutal Dozer. You also cannot shuffle it back to the deck with the Infinitrack Tunneller effect. Main targets to bring from the deck with Urgent Schedule (the choice depends on the gamestate of the match to know which ones are the most correct): ***Urgent Schedule = SS Harvester and SS Trencher = LINK-2 Ballista/Knuckle and have Trencher eff Reborn Harvester and eff Add Dozer Urgent Schedule = SS Harvester and SS Citadel Urgent Schedule = SS Gearframe and SS Bullet Train Urgent Schedule =  SS Gearframe and SS Citadel How to make decisions in some combos: For example if you can do the Combo: Harvester + Redeployment + Discard "Machina" Card (Guaranteed to have Overdrive on the end board) You can decide instead of doing a full combo to just do the standard 1 Card Combo move - certainly thought of the opponent's deck expecting a lot of blind second cards post side deck. ***Redeployment discard Metalcruncher for example are already two excellent searches: Machina Overdrive and Machina Fortress/Citadel so you can decide to play safe. ***Cool of having Fortress + Citadel is you discard Citadel to the GY and already have the interaction setup with the opponent. It happens a lot that you do Harvester/Heavy Forward Add 2nd Brutal Dozer even though you already have one in your hand thinking about the Grind Game and the interactions it will take this turn. Heavy Forward/Harvester 1 Card Combo = You can use River Stormer in GY at the end of the Combo to get rid of Heavy Forward if you have a full trap version of the deck and need space in the s/t zone. Tip: If you draw Machina Redeployment with Tunneller effect you can use it to add Machina Fortress and Machina Citadel and discard Citadel to summon Fortress and improve your End Board. If you only use 1 Trencher in the deck and discard it to pay Machiina Redeployment cost for example you will have to discard or summon cards like Harvester from the deck with Brutal Dozer and Tribute Harvester to summon the Tunneller from hand and make RANK-5 River Stormer to the combo comes out complete. NS Harvester and eff Add Dozer and SS Bullet Train/Derricrane and Harvester eff make BOTH LEVEL12 = Force interaction because if it doesn't come AA-ZEUS. Detail: One thing that is done a lot in the deck in the case of giving Search from Derricrane to the hand with River Stormer in Grind Game is you do again the LINK-1 Goliath to trigger Derricrane eff Special from Hand and Make RANK-10 Gustav Max and RANK-11 Juggernaut Liebe for OTK for example. Interactions involving Machina Ruinforce: Bullet Train Add Ruinforce = free discard to Special Machina Fortress in the Grind Game. The same goes for activating Redeployment in the Grind Game if you haven't sent Ruinforce to the GY yet you add it to the hand to send with the Fortress. Common GY ban cards to summon Machina Ruinforce: SS Runiforce by banishing Unclaspare, Gearframe and Ancient Gear Box. Grind Game with Machina Ruinforce: SS Ruinforce and Opponent's Destroy it and FLOATING EFF SS MachinaFortress and Unclaspare from Banished Zone and Unclaspare eff Foolish Gearframe. The next time you summon Ruinforce you banish Gearframe and Unclaspare to Floating them back to the field and you can Gear Gigant X to Add Harvester and combo. Nibiru, the Primal Being Token vs Gozen Match and Urgent Schedule Interaction: Gozen Match cl1 Urgent Schedule cl2 SS Fortress and SS Harvester That way you get rid of the Nibiru Token in the resolution by choosing to keep Earth monsters on the field and threaten RANK-9 Earth Slicer play on the next turn at the same time the opponent goes start not being able to play when entering the Gozen Match lock which is very good in this format given the use of Adventure Token and that way you can even prevent the opponent from summoning the Destroyer Phoenix Enforcer in SP depending on the attribute left in his field.

deck_excerpt: All “XYZ Format (C)” decks are meant to be played against other “XYZ Format (C)” decks in my deck lists.
deck_description: All "XYZ Format (C)" decks are meant to be played against other "XYZ Format (C)" decks in my deck lists.  The "A" / "B"/ "C" etc. for each refers to different formats, so those decks are from the same era and play fairly against one another according to a common ban-list. Decks from different formats can be played against each other, however, just wont be perfectly fair in terms of ban-lists and cards that were out at those times.  These were all made off meta deck-lists from that era, but were made to be played casually with friends to remember the good 'ol days.  Enjoy!

deck_excerpt: Old-timey Blue-Eyes fusion deck with some newer support.
deck_description: This deck is an evolution of my childhood 2002 to 2006 Dragon beat-down deck; back then themed around the OG Blue-Eyes, Red-Eyes and Lord of D. with Flute. I'm trying to improve the deck, while at least keeping some call-backs to that theme alive in this deck, even if they are not necessarily the best in slot choices.  Protector and Master are meant to be replaced with two Sages, "CotH" with another "RotDL". I totally welcome suggestions, if they try to keep to the theme.

deck_excerpt: Yes, my Fusion Spells uses Fusion Material from the Deck, go cry about it.
deck_description: Hi, Grayewick the Fusionist, back with my favorite Fusion deck that I may or may not have already uploaded, Branded Buster Blader. Before everything else: Yes, my Fusion Spells uses Fusion Material from the Deck, go cry about it. No, I'm not playing the gimmicky "+3 Guardian Chimera" Yacine combo, it just is not as good as having both Red-Eyes Dark Dragoon and Destiny HERO - Destroyer Phoenix Enforcer on board. Also, for now I'll categorize this as just a "Non-Meta Deck" but it's no secret that Branded is already the best deck. "Why play this deck?" Why not? I love Fusion summoning, I love Fusion summoning more than once per turn more, and I love seeing the look at my opponent's faces as I slap both Red-Eyes Dark Dragoon and Destiny HERO - Destroyer Phoenix Enforcer on board after they Ash my Buster Whelp even more. The Main Deck, and their respective alternative options, if any: • x3 Magicians' Souls & x1 Dark Magician - You don't need Magicians' Souls for the draw 1-2. You just need it to send Dark Magician to the GY, unless you drew a Branded Condemnation or an extra copy of Branded Opening, then sure you can pitch them for a draw. Good Ash bait, no real alternatives, except for x3 Nemeses Corridor for a Thunder Dragon Colossus if you're playing in the OCG. • x3 Buster Whelp of the Destruction Swordsman, x1 Buster Blader, the Destruction Swordmaster & Buster Blader - Your main Normal Summon. Searches Prologue of the Destruction Swordsman, which in itself is a 1 card Fusion Summon and Synchro Summon during your opponent's turn, and if your grip is blessed enough, could also end in a Buster lock. No alternatives for this build. • x3 Despian Tragedy - Your main fodder for Branded Opening. Can search either Dramaturge of Despia or Ad Libitum of Despia, for more interruption or recovery, respectively. No alternatives in this build, but you can cut it down to however much you like, although I wouldn't recommend it. • x2 Aluber the Jester of Despia, x2 Fallen of Albaz, & x1 Incredible Ecclesia, the Virtuous - You don't need more than 2 copies of Aluber and Ecclesia outside Despia heavy builds. I'd much rather Special Summon Aluber since Buster Whelp don't trigger upon being Special Summoned. No alternatives, standard ratio. • x2 Fusion Destiny, x1 Destiny HERO - Celestial, & x1 Destiny HERO - Dasher - YEP DPE. For you OCG players, just change Fusion Destiny to Destiny HERO - Denier and Destiny HERO - Plasma. More names = more access to DPE, you don't need Fusion Spells other than Branded Fusion here anyway. • x3 Branded Fusion - Yes, a Fusion Spell that uses Fusion Material from the Deck, go cry about it. "Despia is a scam archetype, don't build it" btw. Money well spent. No alternatives, standard ratio. • x3 Branded Opening, x1 Paradise Branded, & x1 Despia, Theater of the Branded - Searches your Aluber, which searches your Branded Fusion, Paradise Branded, or Despia, Theater of the Branded. It's always good to have an archetypal Magical Meltdown for any Fusion Deck so no reason not to play this card. No alternatives, standard ratio. • x2 Branded Condemnation & x1 Branded Exile - A searchable Solemn Warning that recycles your other Branded Spells/Traps from your GY and a searchable Super Polymerization. That should say more than enough. No alternatives in this build, but you can cut it down or bump it up to however much you like. The Extra Deck: • x1 Red-Eyes Dark Dragoon & x1 Destiny HERO - Destroyer Phoenix Enforcer - Why play one or the other when you can play both? • x1-2 Buster Blader, the Dragon Destroyer Swordsman & x1 Buster Dragon - One of your main boss monsters, although technically all of your Extra Deck are boss monsters in their own right but I digress. It's also a floodgate against Dragon decks, or against anything in tandem with Buster Dragon. No alternatives. • x2 Albion the Branded Dragon, x2 Lubellion the Searing Dragon, & 1 Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon - Your main Albaz targets. Albion Fusion summons by banishing materials, Lubellion Fusion summons by recycling materials, and Mirrorjade is a better Starving Venom Fusion Dragon, which we also play one of. No alternatives. • x1 Despian Quaeritis, x1 Titaniklad the Ash Dragon, & x1 Masquerade the Blazing Dragon - Generic Fusion targets in case you brick, for Despia, Albaz, and both, respectively. Could be anything you feel like splashing, like generic Super Polymerization targets, Mysterion the Dragon Crown, Dark Cavalry, or Dark Paladin, for example. • x1 Abyssal Dragon Alba Renatus - A Chimeratech Fortress Dragon and Invoked Purgatrio for Albaz. This card also searches either your Fusion Destiny or Branded Fusion. No alternatives. Final thoughts: This deck is explosive as shit. I tried my best to cut the ratios down to just 40 cards but often I just feel like handicapping myself by playing an apparently "more consistent 40 card ratio". Play 60 cards of this pile, it'll probably just work itself out just fine. Splash more cards like Qadshaddoll Keios or Naelshaddoll Ariel for El Shaddoll Winda or El Shaddoll Anoyatyllis for them filthy Drytrons, respectively if you want. Overall, I've been testing Albaz and Despia since their release, finding ways on making them work, and it still feels good to laugh at the deniers and finally overshadowing the was once overhyped Swordsoul and Flundereeze. If you have any questions or thoughts, feel free to express them down in the comments and I'll respond to them as soon as I possibly can.

deck_name: Adamancipator/Megalith/Thunder Dragon (No this isn't a joke)
deck_excerpt: An abomination of three archetypes that work together. This deck was conjured from the Abyss by me misreading Researcher.
deck_description: Okay, I have something to admit. This is the first deck I have made from scratch and its origin was me misreading Researcher and thinking its effects applied to Megalith cards.  However, I did realize that they synergized incredibly well with each other so I decided to throw all logic and caution to the wind and it went excellently. Then, when I realized that the deck was a weird number in between 40 and 60 I decided to bring it up to 60 cards and decided to use Thunder Dragons because Colossus is a really good card and it is criminally easy to summon. So with that all thrown together, I set this beast loose on the ranked ladder of Master Duel and I started getting really easy wins and only had one game where I actually bricked fully, and even then I probably could have stalled for time but I had obligations and didn't have time to wait. This is what I would consider an almost perfect version, but the versions I played leading up to this still worked just fine.     So the strat:  Really you are just playing three decks at the same time and they all loosely work together to further each other. I'd say about 70 percent of the starting plays involve Megaliths and summoning Granite and have a Phul on the field. Then you get Researcher and hope you hit a crystal, If you don't I'd recommend going into Leonite in an attempt to hit either Seeker or Friends, Ideally, I'd be playing Signs but I don't have the CP to make them. If you want you can also just save the Phul and researcher to summon a Megalith on your opponent's turn to either disrupt or stall.  You can really just go from there and end up on quite a few good boards and it's highly likely your opponent will just surrender once you start comboing. There are probably quite a few different lines but I haven't played it for nearly long enough to find them out.  Ideal end board:  Probably something like Dragite, Borreload, Access, Titan, and Colossus, possibly Block Dragon. Or you could always just make Draglubion and Numeron swing for the game on the 2nd turn.     Some questions that you might have:  Q: Should the Deck go 1st or 2nd?  A: Honestly either are good but I'd probably say 1st just to set up a strong board. I've had boards with 2 negates and Colossus in one turn.  Q: How expensive is the deck?  A: The Extra Deck is probably the most expensive part of the deck but a lot of the cards are staples such as Borrel, Unicorn, Accesscode, and Numeron Dragon. The main deck is relatively cheap with 18 SR's and 2 UR's but you can reasonably either pull them all from the secret packs or easily craft them, with Maxx C and Called By being staples.  Q: How does the deck play?  A: It's pretty easy, there are moments where some deeper thinking in certain moments would have been useful but in the end it didn't matter.  Q: How is it against meta?  A: So far the only non meta decks I haven't played against are Eldlich and Phantom Knights, but against all the others it was a pretty easy win.  Q: Longest Winstreak?  A: Discounting times I had to surrender due to other obligations or sudden disconnections, above 10, and still going strong.  Q: Ways to improve?  A: Learn the combos, replace friends with Signs, and replace miscellaneous cards with better versions, other than that my lack of experience in both playing the game and deckbuilding can't think of anything.

deck_excerpt: 60-card Adventurer Cyberse Enforcer Eldlich / Cologne WCQ Regional 1st Place
deck_description: Category: Tournament Meta Deck  Tournament Meta Decks are current-level Meta Decks that are capable of going up against the best of the best. These are curated lists that cannot be uploaded by regular users.  Creator: Amel Krijestorac Tournament: Cologne WCQ Regional - March 12th 2022 Placement: 1st Place  https://youtu.be/StS_9gvjr3c

Pro and Cons : Very strong going first deck for MasterDuel. Has some difficulties going second due to lack of kaijus/droplet/imperm ect... No issues getting Plat1 for 2 seasons straight.   12 out of 40 cards in this deck can solo start a combo into Butler. Be carefull, alone, the combo is very unlikely to resolve due to AshBlossom, Imperms, veilers in every decks. Praying to get CbtG or Crossout on the opening hand. Carefull Pandemonium locks special summoning for non-prankids monsters so be sure to summon Toad or/and Colossus beforehand.     Main two extra deck options :  Toadally Awsome : Vanilla Polymerisation + any Kid/field spell result in a Toad Negate on the end Board. Td-Collosus : Any Kid/field spell + thunder dragon Dark OR gold Sarcophagus (OR thunderdragonhawk + crossout NOT RECOMMENDED) result in a Colossus floodgate.     Quick notes on other cards -Emptiness Floodgate can be desactivated at any time by using Butler's or Roarin's effect. -Nibiru and Maxx C are mainly Garnets for crossout designator. -Solemn says No. -Thunderdragon Fusion is searchable by banishing Td-dark. Though, if you actually need it to summun Butler, you probably already lost. The card in the Grave is a safe way to get Fansies to start a whole new combo. -Why veiler instead of imperm ? because you'd be surprised the number of time you get to draw that card on your endphase with Pranks. -Unicorn+AccesscodeTalker are a very reliable way to end the game on turn 3 if the plan went well. You might even not need them if Roarin's got the chance to clear backrow.   Other cards to consider :  Because of the lack of sidedeck, i'm seriously wondering if I should add in more Backrow removal like 1 more copy of Twin Twisters I used to run Monster Reborn and bringing back Toad for another turn was lethal. The negate for another turn came in clutch at many occasions. But I decided to drop it because of all the other boss monsters that can't be reborned in this deck. Verte Anaconda is only here for emergency Butlers but as I said earlier, bringing Butler often won't do much. Still it's a security nice to have. If you don't like it, you can play a copy of Borrelsword Dragon. I've tried to run Apolousa during my second turn but it means giving up on your prankids for one entire turn. It's workable if you wanna try. Even thou I have no respect for Skill Drain players, Skill Drain is a really good floodgate in case you don't want to run Colossus. The Tributing of your own monsters go through the Negation.

deck_excerpt: A deck featuring the card "Final Countdown", which automatically wins you the game over time; the strategy is therefore stalling till you get there.
deck_description: Another deck from me, this time I am trying to build something with "Final Countdown". Time was not particularly nice to the card, since the game not only evolved to be faster than it used to be, but also "Final Countdown" is limited, meaning we have only one copy to work with. The strategy is therefore stalling with the help of "Mystic Mine", getting "Final Countdown" by drawing or searching, and then activating the 20 turn counter. I focussed on only using "Final Countdown" as the winning condition, but it is perfectly possible to but some burn options like "Wave-Motion Cannon" into the mix as a plan B.
To be updated.

deck_excerpt: A powerfull DINO deck with a scrap engine.(SEMI-budget)
deck_description: So basically this is my main deck, I love playing dinos and it is pretty much a budget deck as I am ofc proxying pot of prosp. I would however consider and probably will change the Shenshen with a Borrelord savage dragon. The side deck could use some more work I am open to your guys's tips and comments. The combos are standard dino combos trying to get out the UCT and Omega to shuffle back misc as you overlay depending on who you are playing against.  A bit on my card choice and strats..  Shenshen is in the deck because he is unexpected in a dino deck but has a great effect locking your opponents GY and allowing you to shuffle back misc. Overtex can save you if Shenshen backfires and also has a great effect for blocking spells/traps, also you can send him to the GY with oviraptor and get a pill to your hand. Playing 3 babys?, yes I personally never found my self using petit for getting a pankratops and don't really see a reason to play him when he is a once per turn eff and baby is not so i prefer the third baby as he combos off great with oviraptor or misc from hand.  There is 3 Scrap raptors because him in hand can also be a huge combo with lost world which you have 4 of in you deck. Scrap golem is here to be used as an extra body for Apollousa and he is the only way to bring out Shenshen. Also I would love to swap x3 Chalice with Ashes but as I said it is kind of a budget deck. I think the rest is pretty standard.
Eldlich deck, just for fun

deck_excerpt: Nibiru proof archetype built around interruption and controlling the board. You can go 1st or 2nd with this build. For full combos, watch: https://y
deck_description: In the current meta, add 3 copies of Unchained Twins - Sarama. This will add a new combo: Set any Unchained spell or trap, then destroy it using Unchained Twins - Rakea or Unchained Twins - Aruha. The destroyed spell or trap will summon any Unchained monster from deck, so summon Unchained Twins - Sarama. Sarama will target 1 "Unchained" card in your GY, except itself, and set it to your field, then will destroy 1 card you control which will be either Rakea or Aruha. When you destroy any of those cards, you can special summon 1 "Unchained" monster from your hand or Deck which is Abominable Unchained Soul. Link Sarama with Abominable Unchained Soul into Unchained Soul of Rage. This way, you have 3 cards in hand plus the Unchained card set on field.  https://youtu.be/WtqyxdU_07Q

deck_excerpt: As Brave Engine Prank Kids takes the stage, Prankers may feel like without the abused engine, you could not prank anymore. That's incorrect.
deck_description: As Brave Engine Prank Kids takes the stage, Prankers may feel like without the abused engine, you could not prank anymore. That's incorrect.  Don't get me wrong, the new set of cards baits the majority of hand traps which pretty much kill this deck, but who in the world would want to pay 500+ dollars for 9 cards that may be banned in 5 months.  I've tried countless variations of the deck, trying cheap versions but this one looks the more solid to me.  MAIN DECK  Let's start with the latest arrive: DPE. The card speaks for itself, it's broken as hell and even if you end up with a terrible board because of ash blossom, your fusion destiny is almost guaranteed to resolve and you'll have a reborning 2500/2100 1 card non targetting pop, and you may also special summon a monster and draw 2 because of his OP materials.  Coming to the spicy part, Prank Kids are a one card engine, you want to see at least 1 in your opening and or you'll almost certainly lose the game, so let's do some math. Everyone tends to put every kid at 3 except for rocksies and i agree with them, you dont ever want to banish one card even if you have to if you go with the pranks-line one card combo, so you'll sacrifice one rocksies for that. 3 places are pretty much considered any name (always adding drops or lamps).  That gives you 15 names in 41 totals cards resulting in a 91,22% of drawing at least 1 starting first which is pretty good, given that at 40 the chances increase slightly at 91.9%.  The rest of the cards are a bunch of hand traps and cards that just want to make sure your combo goes off.  For the hand traps you can go whatever you want, i personally dont like impermanence because if you draw it off pranks it's just dead, nibiru is just a godsend with a deck like this that struggles like hell starting second, ash is the best ht in the game in my opinion and ghost belle and meister are extraordinary against DPE(everybody uses him).  For "extendenders"(with this I mean cards that guarantee you dont lose to mono ash on your first kid meaning a loss) you could increase crossout at 3 but if you draw it off pranks it is just a dead ass card like imp before, and all you want to draw are hand traps.  TDF is great if you are in a bad spot and you get nibirud, because at that point you'll have every butler name in your gy and you'll recycle resources which are crucial for this deck. Poly makes sure you end up with TOAD, goated card that helps you a lot and monster reborn could single single handedly recover the game, instant is another way of dodging ash, you summon weather washer, normal a kid and then go into doodle to chain block the kid in gy.  EXTRA DECK:  I fell like extra deck is standard, you play, sadly, 1 meow most important card of the archetype, 3 dodos(you could cut this to 2 but you often go with a combo that uses 2) 1 bow wow that gets you the butler and card effects invulnerability in your opponents turn, rocket ride can let you make disgusting things such as reborning dodo and bow, weather washer is autowin against control decks because people sleep on his effect, if they dont respond before battle they are gone and the last prank kid extra monster is Rip Roaring, you almost never go into this but against eldlich and control decks he is crucial and will win the game alone.  I just won't talk about Anaconda too much, just enjoy our time with it as long as it's not banned, if you have TDF you can go into verte with bow and a kid, and end up with DPE and butler, disgusting.  Toadally awesome doesn't need explanations.  Unicorn and Accesscode are essential in my opinion, if everything goes as planned in your opponents turn you'll have a board made of at least 2 prank kids, you go into dodo, trigger 2 little ones effect then go into unicorn, access black hole opponent and swing at least 5300: crucial.  SIDE  Side whatever you want and you know it's used a lot at your local tournaments, TCBOO it's insanely strong against certain decks and prank kids dont suffer it at all, i would have recommended 3 skill drains but since you are running dpe and verte its often an impairment.  Hope this helps, i also look forward in any suggestions.
